0.title: Centre bound to honour commitment to Portugal, free Abu Salem after 25-year term: SC
0.article_body: The Supreme Court has said the Centre is bound to honour its commitment given to Portugal and release gangster Abu Salem on completion of his 25-year sentence in the 1993 Mumbai blasts case. The court however did not accept Salem's argument that his detention in Portugal should be considered while calculating 25 years of imprisonment. Salem was extradited in 2005.

1.title: 'House of Cards' actress Kate Mara expecting second child with Jamie Bell
1.article_body: Actress Kate Mara is expecting her second child with actor-husband Jamie Bell. The 'House of Cards' actress made the announcement in an Instagram post on Sunday. "There are three of us in this pic," Mara wrote alongside a photograph of herself and Bell holding hands. Mara and Bell are already parents to a daughter, who was born in 2019.

2.title: Rumours about me joining BJP spreading since 2017: Digambar Kamat
2.article_body: Former Goa CM Digambar Kamat said "rumours" about him joining BJP have been spreading since 2017. "If I wanted to go, I'd have gone. No one can stop me. But still, I led party from the front," he added. "I saw a video of the presser of Dinesh Gundu Rao (Goa AICC in-charge)...It has hurt me beyond words," he stated.

3.title: 23-year-old food delivery man killed in hit-and-run in Mohali
3.article_body: A 23-year-old food delivery man died on the Zirakpur-Panchkula flyover in Mohali’s Dhakoli after a speeding canter hit his motorcycle from behind on Saturday. The incident occurred when he was on his way to deliver food, an official said. The canter driver managed to escape. "We've the canter’s registration number and will be arresting the driver soon," the official added.

4.title: China warns Southeast Asian nations to not be used as 'chess pieces'
4.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi while speaking at Association of Southeast Asian Nations' (ASEAN) Secretariat, said, "We should insulate this region from geopolitical calculations…from being used as chess pieces from major power rivalry and from coercion." This comes after Yi met with US State Secretary Antony Blinken last week. "The future of our region should be in our...hands," he added.

5.title: Was nervous for 'Adipurush', didn't know what I was going to do: Kriti
5.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon said that she was nervous about taking up 'Adipurush'. "I didn't know what I was going to do and...how I was going to play part that holds so much importance in our religion and our history...With that weight, you also as an actor feel responsible because you're playing such an iconic character and a part," she added.

6.title: India must be ready to face upheaval due to AI: Rajnath Singh
6.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that India needs to work on artificial intelligence (AI) mechanism "extremely carefully" and it must be ready to face legal, ethical, political and economic upheaval that may follow due to this technology. "It should not be the case that a country or a group of countries establish their dominance on this technology," he added.

7.title: PM Modi unveils 6.5-metre-tall bronze National Emblem on top of new Parliament building
7.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday unveiled the National Emblem cast on the roof of the New Parliament Building, the government said. The bronze cast weighs around 9,500 kg and stands 6.5 metres tall, according to officials. "Historic Moment...Deeply privileged to witness the moment," Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri tweeted.

8.title: Won't take rest till we make Palaniswami CM of Tamil Nadu: AIADMK leader
8.article_body: Soon after Edappadi Palaniswami was elected as AIADMK’s interim General Secretary, ex-state minister and AIADMK leader Natham R Viswanathan said, "We won't take rest till we make E Palaniswami CM of Tamil Nadu." Furthermore, he said, "O Panneerselvam has a dual face. He doesn't want anyone to have a good life." "I'm happy that he is out now," he stated.

9.title: Indian origin humans to travel to space next year: Union Minister
9.article_body: Union Minister of State for Ministry of Science and Technology, Jitendra Singh has said that the preparations for Gaganyaan, India's maiden human space mission, are complete and humans of Indian origin will go to space next year. The trials of the mission scheduled to take place in 2023 will be conducted by the end of this year, the minister said.

10.title: Everyone knows the bowler will bowl short to Shreyas: Parthiv Patel
10.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said Shreyas Iyer could've taken more responsibility during his 119-run partnership with Suryakumar Yadav in the third T20I against England. He further said that Shreyas needs to work on his shot selection. "Everyone knows that bowler will bowl short to Shreyas...He has to decide whether to attack it or survive by taking singles," explained Parthiv.

11.title: LuLu's biggest mall with 11-storey parking, 15 eateries launched in Lucknow
11.article_body: The biggest mall of LuLu Group International has been inaugurated in Lucknow. The mall has an 11-storey parking facility for over 3,000 vehicles. It also has 15 fine-dine restaurants and cafes and a mega food court with 25 brand outlets. The food court has a seating capacity for 1,600 people. The mall also has a dedicated wedding shopping arena.

12.title: Parts of Hyderabad to face water supply disruption on July 13
12.article_body: Parts of Hyderabad will face water supply disruption for 24 hours from 6 am on July 13 due to construction works for a flyover at Al-Jubail Colony, Falaknuma. The areas that will be hit by water supply disruption include - Kishanbagh, Al-Jubail Colony, Santosh Nagar, Vinaynagar, Saidabad, Chanchalguda, Asmangadh, Yakutpura, Madannapet, Mahbub Mansion, Nallakunta, Aliabad and Balapur.

13.title: India projected to surpass China as the world's most populous country next year: UN report
13.article_body: India is projected to surpass China as the world's most populous country next year, according to a report by the UN which said that the world population is forecast to reach 8 billion by mid-November 2022. The latest projections by the UN suggest that the world's population could grow to around 8.5 billion in 2030 and 9.7 billion in 2050.

14.title: Bharti Airtel shares fall 5% as Adani Group enters 5G spectrum auction
14.article_body: Bharti Airtel shares declined nearly 5% during intraday trade on Monday. On Friday, Adani Group confirmed its participation in India's first 5G spectrum auction that is going to be held on July 26. While Adani Group clarified that its intention is not to be in the consumer mobility space, it'll face Reliance Jio, Airtel and Vodafone India during the auction.

15.title: Can't thank my stars enough for getting Nambi Narayanan's biopic: Mishaa
15.article_body: 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' actress Mishaa Ghoshal took to Instagram to share pictures with Nambi Narayanan and wrote, "Can't thank my stars enough for having this...chance to act in your biopic." Mishaa, who portrayed Nambi's daughter Geetha, added the role will always remain close to her heart. She also thanked Madhavan for "choosing [her] to be...part of this beautiful biopic".

16.title: IndiGo clarifies what is 'Cute charge' after passengers share air tickets
16.article_body: Some passengers took to Twitter and shared pictures of the price breakup of their air tickets, showing that IndiGo had levied a 'Cute charge'. Responding to one of the tweets, IndiGo said, "Please know that the CUTE charges are levied at select airports for the usage of Common User Terminal Equipment (CUTE) services...We'd love to serve you on board!"

17.title: John Abraham starts shooting for next action thriller 'Tehran'
17.article_body: Actor John Abraham has started shooting for 'Tehran', an action thriller film directed by Arun Gopalan. Taking to Instagram, he shared a motion poster, revealing his look from the upcoming project. "Time for some ACTION! #Tehran shoot begins," he wrote. Written by Ritesh Shah and Ashish P Verma, it will be produced by Dinesh Vijan, Shobhna Yadav and Sandeep Leyzell.

18.title: MVA allies should contest 2024 state Assembly polls together: Sharad Pawar
18.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Sunday said it's his personal wish that the three MVA allies, NCP, Shiv Sena and Congress, should fight the 2024 Maharashtra Assembly elections together. "This is my personal opinion. I'll first have to discuss the issue with my party leaders and talks can then be held with the alliance partners," he added.

19.title: Biden says he's considering abortion-related public health emergency
19.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Sunday told reporters that it is "critically important" for people to continue to protest over Supreme Court's ruling on abortion. Moreover, on being questioned about declaring an abortion-related public health emergency, he said that he has asked his administration to consider whether he has the authority to do it and what its impacts would be.

20.title: Defer disqualification pleas against Uddhav, Shinde camps: SC to Maha Speaker
20.article_body: The Supreme Court has asked Maharashtra Speaker Rahul Narwekar to defer disqualification petitions pending against both the Eknath Shinde faction and the Uddhav Thackeray camp. "Please inform the Assembly Speaker not to take up the disqualification petitions until this court hears the matter. Matters won't be listed tomorrow but inform the Speaker," Chief Justice of India, NV Ramana, said.

21.title: Mallya didn't show any remorse, adequate punishment must: SC in contempt case
21.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday while sentencing fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya to four months in jail for a 2017 contempt of court case, said that the latter didn’t show any remorse and didn't appear before it during the sentencing. The court added, "Adequate punishment is a must to uphold the majesty of the law.” The court also fined him ₹2,000.

22.title: O Panneerselvam expelled from all AIADMK posts as Palaniswami takes charge
22.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister O Panneerselvam was on Monday expelled from all posts of the AIADMK after Edappadi K Palaniswami took control of the party as its interim General Secretary. Senior leaders and OPS supporters- JCD Prabhakar, R Vaithilingam and PH Manoj Pandian were also expelled from the AIADMK.

23.title: I'm not vaccinated and I don’t plan to get vaccinated: Djokovic on US Open
23.article_body: Novak Djokovic, who won his seventh Wimbledon title on Sunday, has said he's not sure about his future events due to his unvaccinated status against COVID-19. He stated, "I'm not vaccinated and I'm not planning to get vaccinated." Djokovic is likely to miss the US Open as the country does not allow unvaccinated travellers to enter its borders.

24.title: You look better than you did while working on it: Dalip to Kajol on 'Gupt'
24.article_body: As 'Gupt' clocked 25 years, actor Dalip Tahil told actress Kajol she looks better now than she did while she was working on the movie. Kajol also recalled how she took up the movie. "When Rajiv narrated script to me, I read it and said, 'I'll do it'...He was like, 'You'll really do it? I can't believe it'," she added.

25.title: BJP spokesperson spoke nonsense & our delegates apologised in other countries: KCR
25.article_body: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday said that one Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) spokesperson spoke "nonsense" and our delegates and ambassadors apologised in other countries. "Why should the country apologise when BJP has done something wrong?" he asked. Earlier, BJP suspended Nupur Sharma following her remarks on Prophet Muhammad.

26.title: Thappad se dar nahi lagta…Biwi ke surprise se lagta hai: Gaurav Taneja over arrest
26.article_body: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja has tweeted, "Thappad se darr nahi lagta sahab...Biwi ki surprise planning se lagta hai..#birthday". Taneja was arrested on Saturday after thousands of people gathered at a metro station in Noida to celebrate his birthday. His wife Ritu Rathee Taneja wanted to give him a surprise by hosting his birthday in a four-coach Metro, according to the couple.

27.title: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja shares memes over his arrest on birthday
27.article_body: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja (Flying Beast) has shared several memes on his arrest over birthday celebration in Noida metro. He also shared a meme trolling his wife Ritu Rathee for organising a surprise party. He was arrested by the Noida police on Saturday after thousands of people turned up at his 'surprise birthday party' at a Noida metro station.

28.title: Return $40 mn sent to family with 8% interest in 4 weeks: SC to Mallya in 2017 case
28.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday sentenced fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya to four months in jail for a 2017 contempt of court case. Mallya was convicted of contempt in 2017 for transferring $40 million to his children in violation of court orders. The top court has now asked Mallya to return $40 million within four weeks with 8% interest.

29.title: Man cheats Mumbai's customs official of ₹13.50 lakhs by selling fake gold coins
29.article_body: A senior customs official lodged a complaint with police alleging that he was cheated of ₹13.50 lakhs by a man who sold him fake British-era gold coins. As per the victim, he got the coins checked with a jeweller who authenticated them as real. However, during the time of handing over the coins, the seller changed them with fake ones.

30.title: UK Foreign Minister Liz Truss announces bid to run for PM
30.article_body: UK Foreign Minister Liz Truss has announced her bid to succeed Boris Johnson as the next Prime Minister. She wrote in The Telegraph, "Under my leadership, I would start cutting taxes from day one to take immediate action to help people deal with...cost of living." Truss joined 10 other candidates who have declared their bid to run for the post.

31.title: Feels surreal when people call me Avantika: Tamannaah on 7 yrs of Baahubali
31.article_body: Tamannaah Bhatia took to Twitter to share a post marking seven years of her movie 'Baahubali: The Beginning'. The actress, who played Avantika in the film, wrote, "Even after 7 years...when people call me Avantika, it feels surreal." Tamannaah added she feels proud to be a part of a film franchise that has made an impact all over the world.

32.title: Djokovic is a bit of God, I'm not gonna lie: Kyrgios after Wimbledon final
32.article_body: After suffering defeat in the Wimbledon final against Novak Djokovic, Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios said the seven-time Wimbledon champion is a "bit of God". He added, "I played a Slam final against one of the greatest of all time...It was a hell of an occasion." Djokovic won the match 4-6, 6-3, 6-4, 7-6(7-3) in three hours.

33.title: Rupee hits new record low of 79.38 against US dollar
33.article_body: The Indian rupee touched an all-time low of 79.38 against the US dollar during Monday's early trade. On Friday, the Indian rupee had closed at a record low of 79.26 against the US dollar. On Monday, domestic markets opened lower with BSE Sensex declining 372.15 points to 54,109.69, and the Nifty was down nearly 0.6% at 16,126.45.

34.title: It was horrifying, river water turned black: Amarnath cloudburst survivor
34.article_body: Nitin Sharma from Rajasthan, who was in Amarnath on the day of the cloudburst, said "it was horrifying". "When we were just one km away from the Baltal base camp, we saw that the water of the river got black and the water level started rising. This seemed...strange," he said, adding he has never seen "such a dark cloud".

35.title: Vijay Mallya sentenced to 4 months in jail, fined ₹2,000 in 2017 contempt case by SC
35.article_body: The Supreme Court has sentenced fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya to four months in jail and imposed a fine of ₹2,000 on him after he was found guilty of contempt of court in 2017 for withholding information from the court. The court also reportedly ordered Mallya's family members to return $40 million transferred to them in violation of the court orders.

36.title: Wife, ex-wife, daughter arrested for hiring shooter to kill DTC employee
36.article_body: Days after a Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) bus driver was shot dead, the Delhi Police arrested his wife, his ex-wife and his 21-year-old daughter for allegedly planning the murder conspiracy. According to the police, they hired a contract killer for ₹15 lakh to execute the murder. Two others, including the contract killer, are absconding, the police said.

37.title: Electricity bills in Delhi for June jumps by 2-6%
37.article_body: The electricity bills received this month by Delhi residents have reflected a hike of 2-6%. The hike, which came into effect on June 10, has happened due to the imposition of an additional power purchase adjustment cost surcharge. Notably, the surcharge will be in effect till August 31, 2022, or till further orders, the Delhi Electricity Regulatory Commission said.

38.title: 3 women destroy US restaurant, attack workers over $1.75 for extra sauce; video surfaces
38.article_body: Three women have been arrested and charged with robbery and criminal mischief after they were filmed destroying a New York City restaurant and attacking workers over $1.75 for extra sauce. One woman was seen hurling a can while other two climbed over the counter and launched bottles of sauce. At one point, one of them even danced on the counter.

39.title: Musk shares laughing meme as Twitter plans legal action against him for ending deal
39.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a meme on Monday after he terminated the $44 billion Twitter deal on Friday. The meme featured Musk laughing at statements such as 'They said I couldn't buy Twitter' and 'They want to force me to buy Twitter in court'. Twitter plans to take legal action against Musk to force him to accept the deal.

40.title: Palaniswami, Panneerselvam supporters clash in TN; some injured
40.article_body:
Some people were injured after supporters of AIADMK leaders Edappadi K Palaniswami and 
O Panneerselvam clashed near the party's headquarters in Tamil Nadu's Chennai amid its General Council meeting. This comes after the Madras High Court allowed AIADMK to hold the meeting today after rejecting Panneerselvam's plea to stall it. A video of the clash shows people throwing chairs.

41.title: India categorically denies reports of sending troops to Sri Lanka
41.article_body: The Indian High Commission in Sri Lanka has categorically denied "speculative" reports of India sending its troops to Sri Lanka. This comes as protesters in Sri Lanka entered the President's official home and set the Prime Minister's private residence on fire amid the economic crisis. "These reports...are also not in keeping with the position of Government of India," it added.

42.title: Some people think they are born to rule: Shinde on Uddhav
42.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said that he was not born with a "golden spoon" and is a common man. Referring to Uddhav Thackeray, he said, "Some people think they are born to rule...They should have felt proud that a common man has assumed the chair." "They are filing petitions...But even the court knows...We haven't done anything illegal," Shinde added.

43.title: Sri Lankan Oppn meets to form new govt as Prez, PM offer to resign
43.article_body: Sri Lankan Opposition parties met on Sunday to agree on the formation of a new government as President Gotabaya Rajapaksa and PM Ranil Wickremesinghe offered to resign amid the country's economic crisis. This comes as protesters entered the President's official home and set the PM's private residence on fire. Four Sri Lankan Cabinet ministers have also resigned.

44.title: Video shows stadium developing cracks as football fans jump in Argentina
44.article_body: A video of cracks developing in La Bombonera stadium in Argentina as fans jumped during a Copa Libertadores match between Boca Juniors and Brazilian side Corinthians recently is being widely shared online. The cracks in one of the upper tier stands could be seen moving under the weight of the fans. 'A catastrophe waiting to happen,' a person tweeted.

45.title: Gulzar-Sanjeev Kumar pairing was like Martin Scorsese-Robert De Niro: Anil
45.article_body: Anil Kapoor has said actor Sanjeev Kumar's creative partnership with veteran filmmaker-lyricist Gulzar was equivalent to Martin Scorsese and Robert De Niro's pairing. Sanjeev and Gulzar collaborated on several films including 'Mausam', 'Aandhi', 'Angoor', 'Koshish' and 'Parichay'. Anil was speaking at an event celebrating the 84th birth anniversary of Sanjeev.

46.title: Need to find a way to play players in form in T20Is: Virender Sehwag
46.article_body: Reacting to India's defeat in the third T20I against England, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said India have players who can get going from the start, but unfortunately some of them are sitting out. He added, "Need to find a way to play the best available players in current form in T20 cricket." England won the third T20I by 17 runs.

47.title: Palaniswami elected as AIADMK's interim General Secretary, post elections in 4 months
47.article_body: During a meeting held on Monday, Edappadi Palaniswami was elected as AIADMK's interim General Secretary. AIADMK General Council has adopted resolutions for reviving the general secretary post. It has also adopted resolutions to ensure electing a person for the post by the primary members of the party. The election will be held 4 months from now, news agency ANI reported.

48.title: Lobo, Kamat hatched conspiracy for defection in Cong: Goa AICC in-charge
48.article_body: Goa AICC in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao said Michael Lobo, who was removed as LoP and ex-CM Digambar Kamat were hatching a "conspiracy" by "hobnobbing" with BJP to ensure defection in Congress in Goa. "Kamat did it to safeguard his own skin as so many cases are against him, Lobo did it for the sake of power and position," Rao added.

49.title: Video of 27 people coming out of single auto-rickshaw in UP goes viral
49.article_body: A video of an auto-rickshaw driver carrying 26 passengers, including elderly and children, in Uttar Pradesh is going viral on social media. The video showed police stopping the vehicle before asking all the passengers to deboard the three-wheeler and counting them. The auto, which was first spotted in Fatehpur, has been seized, according to reports.

50.title: Uber used 'kill switch' 13 times in 2014-16 in India & other nations, show leaked mails
50.article_body: The leaked emails have revealed that Uber deployed 'kill switch' 13 times between 2014-2016 in different nations globally. The 'kill switch' turned off systems in the event of serious regulatory action, like a tax raid. It was used in India, Amsterdam, and Paris, among others. In six cases it was used while raids were in progress.

51.title: I want to be attention in room & want the focus on me; I seek that: Karan
51.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said that there are two parts of his personality. He spoke about being shy and an introvert in his childhood but added that he also wants to be the attention in the room. "I want the focus on me, I seek that as well. I don't run away from the fact that this is business," he added.

52.title: Madras HC allows AIADMK meeting for today; rejects Panneerselvam's plea
52.article_body: The Madras High Court has given a nod to AIADMK's general council meeting to be held today. The High Court also rejected O Panneerselvam's plea to stall the meeting. The meeting proposes to revive interim general secretary post and abolish coordinator as well as joint coordinator posts. The verdict was delivered on Monday morning.

53.title: 52 policewomen caught 100 criminals in last 1 year: Delhi Police
53.article_body: A year after the Tejaswini scheme was launched by Delhi's northwest district police, 52 female police personnel have caught 100 criminals including molesters, bootleggers and robbers. The scheme aimed at curbing crime against women and children, and also, empowering the females of the district, DCP (northwest) Usha Rangani said. Notably, the 52 Tejaswinis also counsel vulnerable girls, Usha added.

54.title: India reports 16,678 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases jump to 1,30,713
54.article_body: India has reported 16,678 COVID-19 cases, 14,629 recoveries and 26 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 18,257 cases and 42 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,30,713, while the death toll reached 5,25,454.

55.title: My son is learning acting, he will be a huge superstar: Vindu Dara Singh
55.article_body: Actor Vindu Dara Singh has said his son Fateh Randhawa will be a "huge superstar". "Just wait for him this year, and you'll come to know," he added. Vindu further said Fateh has been learning acting, dance and action for the past couple of years, adding, "If I had done so much hard work, I would have been a superstar."

56.title: Auto-rickshaw carrying 27 people stopped in UP; video shows police counting people
56.article_body: A video of an auto-rickshaw driver carrying 26 passengers, including elderly and children, in Uttar Pradesh is going viral on social media. The video showed police stopping the vehicle before asking all the passengers to deboard the three-wheeler and counting them. The auto, which was first spotted in Fatehpur, has been seized, according to reports.

57.title: Watching SRK's old movies nowadays, love him in negative roles: Shehnaaz
57.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill said that she is watching actor Shah Rukh Khan's old movies nowadays and that she loves 'Darr' and 'Baazigar'. She also said that she loves watching Khan in negative roles. In a video shared on her YouTube channel, she also mentioned her favourite fruit and who she connects that fruit to.

58.title: It was a fantastic game, we had slightly above-par score: Buttler
58.article_body: Speaking at the post-match presentation ceremony after winning the third T20I against India, England captain Jos Buttler said, "Good fun to play, fantastic game. I thought we had a slightly above-par score." Buttler also praised Reece Topley, who registered figures of 3/22 in the match. England put up a total of 215/7 and won by 17 runs.

59.title: There’re several Eknath Shindes in TRS: Telangana BJP chief
59.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar said there are several "Eknath Shindes" in TRS. "You (KCR) are state’s CM who is saying, BJP doesn’t have any strategy," he added. "He fears that leaders like Eknath Shinde are growing in his own party…Anyone can become Eknath Shinde in his party, it might be his son KTR, daughter or nephew," Kumar stated.

60.title: Violence guarantees success: Ex-Uber CEO in leaked emails amid driver protests
60.article_body: Leaked emails have revealed that Uber's former CEO Travis Kalanick encouraged Uber drivers to stage counter-protests amid taxi strikes and riots in Paris in 2016. Warned about its risks, Kalanick reportedly said, "I think it’s worth it...Violence guarantees success." Later, Kalanick's spokesperson said, "He never suggested Uber should take advantage of violence at the expense of driver safety."

61.title: 95 accidents involving PMPML buses in 15 months, 22 deaths reported
61.article_body: At least 95 accidents involving Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) were reported in 15 months from April 2021 to June 2022, reports said. Data said that in these accidents, 22 people were reported to have lost their lives. "PMPML should take strict measures against drivers when they are found to be guilty," secretary of PMP Pravasi Manch said.

62.title: What are some of the key revelations made by the 1,24,000 leaked 'Uber files'?
62.article_body: A collection of 1,24,000 leaked documents, known as the 'Uber files' and obtained by The Guardian, reveal that Uber flouted laws, duped police and secretly lobbied governments as it sought global expansion. Uber used a blocking software, internally called the 'kill switch', to prevent local police from accessing its data. Further, it discreetly courted world leaders, billionaires and media barons.

63.title: Bengaluru Police seizes properties of 3 drug peddlers over narco cases
63.article_body: The properties of three habitual offenders involved in narcotics trade have been seized, the Bengaluru Police said on Sunday. "This (property) attachment is a new thing. It will be quite effective in the long run," Joint Commissioner Raman Gupta said. This comes a day after Bengaluru Police, for the very first time, attached assets of a drug peddler on Saturday.

64.title: Hyderabad Police issues advisory amid red alert warning in the city
64.article_body: The Hyderabad Police issued an advisory urging people to avoid non-essential travel after the meteorological department sounded red alert warning in the city until Tuesday. The police also asked people to watch the weather and rain forecasts before venturing out. "All educational institutions have been closed by the government for three days," the advisory issued on Sunday stated.

65.title: I've been watching Suryakumar for a while now, he's magnificent: Rohit
65.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma said he's proud of the fight they gave in the third T20I against England on Sunday. "I thought it was a fantastic chase although we fell short," he stated. Rohit also praised Suryakumar Yadav for his 117-run innings, stating that the 31-year-old has grown from strength to strength since they got him into the squad.

66.title: There's no system to forecast cloudburst events worldwide: IMD scientist
66.article_body: Following the Amarnath cloudburst incident, IMD scientist RK Jenamani said that worldwide, there is no system to forecast cloudburst events. "The modelling system often cannot catch how quickly these systems develop and how intense they are," he added. "The accumulation of a lot of moisture in the mountain topography leads to such events," he stated.

67.title: Man complains train has been hijacked; railway police replies 'it's diverted, not hijacked'
67.article_body: A passenger on Sunday took to Twitter to complain that train number 12650 (Karnataka Sampark Kranti Express) has been "hijacked" and sought help from the authorities. Responding to the tweet, the Railway Police Force replied, "Sir, The train is not hijacked. Train is diverted. Don't get panic." The Twitter thread is being widely shared online.

68.title: JEE Main 2022 session 1 results declared
68.article_body: The results for the Joint Entrance Examination Main (JEE Main) Session 1 were declared by the National Testing Agency (NTA) on the morning of Monday. The results are available on the following websites - nta.ac.in, ntaresults.nic.in, and jeemain.nta.nic.in. The second session of JEE Main is scheduled to be held from 21 to 30 July.

69.title: Gujarat sees heavy rains, bridge washed away; evacuation arrangements made
69.article_body: A flood-like situation has emerged in Gujarat amid heavy rainfall the state is witnessing. Amid rainfall, the bridge connecting Panchol and Kumbhiya villages in Tapi district was washed away. Meanwhile, over 700 people were evacuated from two districts in South Gujarat. The state Disaster Management Minister said that arrangements are being made to shift people staying in low-lying areas.

70.title: NZ create world record for scoring most runs in the 50th over while chasing in an ODI
70.article_body: New Zealand set the world record for scoring most runs in the 50th over while chasing in an ODI. Requiring 20 runs to win from last over against Ireland in first ODI, New Zealand's Michael Bracewell slammed 24 runs in five balls. The previous record, in any ODI chase, was held jointly by England and Afghanistan, who scored 20 runs.

71.title: Don't know who these experts are and why they're called experts: Rohit on Kohli's critics
71.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma, while defending Virat Kohli amid criticism over his bad form, said, "I don't know who these experts are and why they're called experts." He added, "They're seeing from outside, they don't know what's happening inside the team. We've a thought process, we make the team, we debate and discuss...and think a lot about it."

72.title: Twitter hires US law firm that invented 'poison pill' to sue Musk for ending deal: Report
72.article_body: Twitter has reportedly hired US law firm Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz as it prepares legal action against Tesla CEO Elon Musk, who terminated the $44 billion deal. The firm served Musk as a legal adviser in his plan to take Tesla private in 2018 and its founding partner, Martin Lipton, is credited with inventing the 'poison pill' strategy.

73.title: Rohit Sharma's 10-year-old tweet on Suryakumar goes viral after his T20I hundred
73.article_body: Rohit Sharma's 10-year-old tweet on Suryakumar Yadav has gone viral after the latter slammed his maiden T20I hundred against England on Sunday. The tweet dated December 10, 2011, reads, "Just got done with BCCI awards here in Chennai...some exciting cricketers coming up...Suryakumar Yadav from Mumbai to watch out for in future!" Suryakumar slammed 117 runs off 55 deliveries.

74.title: Work begins on 1,500 rainwater harvesting pits in Delhi, PWD floats tenders
74.article_body: On directions of Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia, work has started on 1,500 rainwater harvesting pits across city. Officials said Public Works Department has floated tenders for its construction at Aurobindo Marg road and locations including South West, South East, North East and North West. An official said department is planning to construct 12 pits in South West Delhi.

75.title: Uber execs blamed Indian authorities after Delhi woman's rape by driver: Leaked files
75.article_body: Leaked internal communications between Uber executives in 2014 show they tried to put the blame for a Delhi woman's rape by an Uber driver, on Indian authorities. A former top official Mark MacGann talked about "weakness/flaw" in the "licensing scheme". Another senior official blamed Delhi Police for not identifying "some previous rape allegations" in the accused driver's 'character certificate'.

76.title: 'Don't talk to govt, be unresponsive,' Uber Asia Head told India team: Leaked email
76.article_body: Uber's then Asia Head Allen Penn told its Indian team in August 2014 to not "talk to government or folks close to the government" about any regulatory issues that Uber faces in India. "We'll generally stall, be unresponsive and often say no to what they want," Penn told the Indian team, as per leaked emails accessed by the Indian Express.

77.title: 'We're just f***ing illegal,' Uber executive said days after 2014 Delhi rape incident
77.article_body: Uber's former head of communications unit, Nairi Hourdajian, in an email to her colleague in 2014 said, "Remember that everything is not in your control, and that sometimes we have problems because, well, we're just f***ing illegal." The email, obtained by The Guardian, was sent six days after a 25-year-old woman passenger was raped by an Uber driver in Delhi.

78.title: 95 accidents involving PMPML buses in 15 months, 22 deaths reported
78.article_body: At least 95 accidents involving Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) were reported from April 2021 to June 2022, in which 22 people lost their lives, according to reports. Many accidents also happen because of poor maintenance of the buses, said Sanjay Shitole, secretary of PMP Pravasi Manch. The number of unrecorded accidents is huge, Shitole added.

79.title: Action sought against 2 Canada-based men for priest's murder in India
79.article_body: India has asked Canadian authorities to prioritise the investigation into two persons based in the country who have been named in a chargesheet by the NIA in connection with the 2021 killing of a priest in Punjab. Hardeep Nijjar and Arshdeep Singh were accused of conspiring to murder Kamaldeep Sharma. Nijjar is associated with the Sikhs for Justice separatist group.

80.title: German trade union calls for strike of Amazon workers on Prime Day
80.article_body: One of Germany's biggest trade unions, Verdi, has called on staff at seven Amazon warehouses across the country to go on strike during Sunday's night shift. The strike will coincide with Amazon's Prime Day sale, and has been organised as part of a longer battle regarding better pay and working conditions. Amazon doesn't expect this to impact its operations.

81.title: RBI imposes restrictions, withdrawal caps on 4 cooperative banks
81.article_body: The RBI has put withdrawal limits on four cooperative banks for six months due to their deteriorating financial positions. They also cannot grant or renew any loans, make investments or accept fresh deposits without RBI's approval. The banks include Delhi's Ramgarhia Co-operative Bank, Mumbai's Sahebrao Deshmukh Co-operative Bank and Sangli Sahakari Bank.

82.title: SIDBI to develop online platform for startups, investors
82.article_body: The Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) will develop an online platform to bring together startups and investors. The platform will be ready in two months, said Shruti Singh, Joint Secretary, Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT). This portal, she added, would help startups as they would not look for Alternate Investment Funds (AIFs) outside.

83.title: Steel price has hit bottom: Industry amid 24% drop from April peak
83.article_body: Industry experts have said the price of steel has bottomed out and there is no headroom for it to go further down. Their remarks come as the price of benchmark hot-rolled coil (HRC) dropped to ₹59,800 a tonne on July 6. This is 24% less than its April 6 peak of ₹78,000 a tonne, as per data from SteelMint.

84.title: Govt exempts excise duty on ATF for Indian carriers flying overseas
84.article_body: The government has exempted excise duty on Aviation Turbine Fuel (ATF) for domestic airlines flying overseas. This has brought domestic carriers at par with international airlines. However, airlines will continue to pay 11% excise duty on ATF for flying domestically. Exemption from basic and special additional excise duty would be applicable retrospectively from July 1, Finance Ministry said.

85.title: Investors would ask me about work-life balance in 2009: Open COO Mabel
85.article_body: Neo-banking platform Open's COO, Mabel Chacko, said she has been lucky to receive investors who have been strong proponents of merit. Chacko, who co-founded the startup with her husband in 2017, said if it was 2009, investors would ask her about work-life balance or how she could start a company with her husband. Investors are now more gender-neutral, she added.

86.title: Uber used 'kill switch' to block info from Indian govt in 2014-15, leaked emails reveal
86.article_body: Uber used a unique blocking software called "kill switch" to block Indian authorities from accessing data sometime during 2014 and 2015, The Indian Express reported citing leaked emails. The software would cut off access to Uber's main systems, preventing authorities from gathering evidence. Notably, Uber was under probe after a driver sexually assaulted a woman passenger in Delhi in 2014.

87.title: Trade transactions with Sri Lanka may be settled outside ACU: RBI
87.article_body: All current account transactions including trade transactions with Sri Lanka may be settled in any permitted currency outside the Asian Clearing Union (ACU) mechanism until further notice, the RBI said. The ACU facilitates payments among member countries on a multilateral basis, thereby economising on the use of foreign exchange reserves and transfer costs. Currently, it has nine members.

88.title: Netflix's exit from Russia, inflation caused its slowdown: Co-CEO
88.article_body: Netflix Co-CEO Ted Sarandos has said there are multiple factors behind the streaming service's slowdown, including inflation's impact on household budgets, a decline in smart TV sales and its departure from Russia. "Every customer is asking the question of the value of a subscription in relation to its cost," he said. Notably, Netflix lost 2,00,000 subscribers in Q1 2022.

89.title: IIT grad wins ₹5 lakh for making device to keep agri produce fresh
89.article_body: IIT graduate Nikky Kumar Jha bagged the first prize at Schaeffler India's Social Innovator Fellowship Program for his startup Saptkrishi Scientific, which innovated a storage device that keeps agricultural produce like fruits and vegetables fresh for 30 days. Jha, who hails from Bihar, received ₹5 lakh as prize. He claimed the device consumes much less electricity than a refrigerator.

90.title: Policeman slaps boy for skateboarding in Delhi's Safdarjung Enclave
90.article_body: A police officer allegedly slapped a boy for skateboarding in Delhi's Safdarjung Enclave during an argument. Delhi Police received complaints from residents regarding boys skateboarding in the area and causing disturbances, and the argument broke out when the constable went to reprimand the boys. Police said that they have asked concerned officials to take suitable action against the constable.

91.title: AMCs added 51 lakh investor accounts in June quarter: AMFI data
91.article_body: Asset Management Companies added 51 lakh investor accounts in the June quarter, as per the data by the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI). The total tally now stands at 13.46 crore. In comparison, 93 lakh accounts were opened in the March quarter, the data further showed. Notably, the industry crossed 10 crore folios in May 2021.

92.title: Aurobindo Pharma to reduce raw material imports from China
92.article_body: India's second-largest pharmaceuticals firm Aurobindo Pharma is planning to significantly reduce raw material imports from China to mitigate the risk of supply chains disruptions. It currently procures around 55% of its material from China. The company is also planning to shift the manufacturing of some of its pharmaceutical formulations from India to a newly built facility in China.

93.title: 4 Wimbledon titles in a row is no mean feat: Tendulkar on Djokovic
93.article_body: Praising Novak Djokovic following his fourth straight Wimbledon title, Sachin Tendulkar said it is no mean feat. "Djokovic's composure, focus...consistency has been the hallmark of his game over the years. Lovely to see Novak appreciating Nick Kyrgios and the staff at Wimbledon after this win," he tweeted. Overall, it was Djokovic's seventh Wimbledon title. He beat Kyrgios in the final.

94.title: Work quickly to find long-term solution: US to S Lanka amid crisis
94.article_body: The US on Sunday urged the political fraternity in Sri Lanka to "work quickly" to achieve long-term solutions amid ongoing protests due to the economic crisis. "Sri Lankan people have the right to peacefully raise their voices, and we call for the full investigation, arrest and prosecution of anyone involved in any protest-related incidents," a US State Department spokesperson said.

95.title: India's economic performance consistently improved in last 4 yrs: PHDCCI
95.article_body: India's economic performance consistently improved among the top 10 economies in the world over the last four years, PHD Chamber of Commerce and Industry (PHDCCI) said. It cited International Economic Resilience (IER) rankings, wherein India's position improved from 6th in 2019 to 2nd in 2022. India showed consistent improvement despite the COVID-19 crisis, PHDCCI President Pradeep Multani said.

96.title: Who wouldn't want to be in SRK film: Taapsee on the film Dunki
96.article_body: Speaking about working with actor Shah Rukh Khan in film 'Dunki', actress Taapsee Pannu said, "I am so happy and glad that it is this film I am doing with Rajkumar Hirani and Shah Rukh Khan." "Who wouldn't want to be in an SRK film? I was lucky...I got this one which has such a pivotal part," she said.

97.title: INS Vikrant successfully completes fourth phase of sea trials
97.article_body: India's indigenously developed aircraft carrier INS Vikrant successfully completed the fourth phase of sea trials on Sunday, Indian Navy informed. This phase included integrated trials of major equipment and systems, including key aviation equipment, the Navy said. The aircraft carrier's delivery is targeted at the end of July, followed by its induction in August, it added.

98.title: Car falls into rivulet on state highway in K'taka, 2 feared dead
98.article_body: A car on the Manjeshwar-Puttur-Subrahmanya state highway in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada district was washed away after it accidentally fell into a rivulet. Police said that the incident came to light after watching CCTV footage. A search operation by the police, fire and emergency services recovered the car but the two passengers were missing.

99.title: Suryakumar breaks record for highest T20I score by an Indian outside India
99.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav has broken the record for registering the highest-ever T20I score by an Indian outside India. Suryakumar smashed 117(55) against England in the third T20I at Trent Bridge in Nottingham to set the record. The previous record was set by KL Rahul on August 27, 2016, when he scored 110*(51) against West Indies in USA's Lauderhill.

100.title: Telangana BJP Chief to resume third phase of padayatra on August 2
100.article_body: Telangana's BJP Chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar will resume the third phase of his padayatra, 'Praja Sangrama Yatra', on August 2 for 20 days, BJP general secretary Tarun Chugh announced. He further added that Kumar will sit on a silent protest on Monday regarding issue of Podu lands. To address people's problems, bike rallies will also be organised from July 21.

101.title: England beat India, deny Rohit his world record 20th consecutive win as captain
101.article_body: England defeated India by 17 runs in the third T20I at Trent Bridge in Nottingham on Sunday, with India winning the series 2-1. With the win, England denied Rohit Sharma his world record 20th consecutive victory as captain in international cricket. Rohit would've equalled ex-Australia skipper Ricky Ponting's world record for most consecutive wins as captain had India won.

102.title: 2 Ukrainian army hangars storing US-made M777s destroyed: Russia
102.article_body: The Russian Defence Ministry on Sunday claimed that its forces have struck two Ukrainian military hangars that were storing US-made M777 howitzer guns. The ministry added that the hangars were situated near Kostantinovka in the Donetsk region. Ukraine has reportedly received around 100 M777s from the US and its allies, since the beginning of the war with Russia.

103.title: 7th heaven: US Open on Djokovic winning his 7th Wimbledon title
103.article_body: Following top seed Novak Djokovic's seventh Wimbledon title after defeating unseeded Nick Kyrgios in the final on Sunday, US Open took to Twitter and wrote, "Seventh heaven." It added, "Djokovic ties Pete Sampras with his seventh Wimbledon title." It's Djokovic's fourth consecutive title at the grass-court Grand Slam. Now only Roger Federer, with eight, has won more in men's singles.

104.title: Oath Keeper brought explosives to DC ahead of Capitol riot: US DOJ
104.article_body: The US Department of Justice (DOJ) has said in a court filing that a member of the Oath Keepers extremist group brought explosives to the Washington, DC area ahead of the January 6 Capitol riot. Prosecutors have alleged that Jeremy Brown, an Oath Keepers member from Florida, transported explosives to a Virginia hotel in his recreational vehicle on January 6.

105.title: SEBI may issue 'risk factor disclosures' on market trends: Report
105.article_body: The SEBI is reportedly planning to issue "risk factor disclosures" on market trends, including surges and collapses, to help investors make better decisions. Sources told PTI that the regulator has huge amounts of datasets and is in a position to analyse things that have gone good or bad for the investors. The disclosures might be made annually, half-yearly or quarterly.

106.title: How much prize money did Wimbledon winners and runners up get?
106.article_body: Serbia's Novak Djokovic and Kazakhstan's Elena Rybakina, who won the men's and women's singles titles, respectively, at the Wimbledon this year, won £2,000,000 (nearly ₹19 crore) each as prize money. Meanwhile, men's singles runner up Australia's Nick Kyrgios and women's singles runner up Tunisia's Ons Jabeur won £1,050,000 (nearly ₹10 crore) each.

107.title: Sara upset with Karan for confirming relationship with Kartik: Report
107.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan is upset with filmmaker Karan Johar for confirming her past relationship with actor Kartik Aaryan, Bollywood Life reported quoting a source. Kartik and Sara starred together in 2020 film 'Love Aaj Kal' and reportedly began dating during filming. Sara had also spoken about wanting to date Kartik during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan' in 2018.

108.title: Ferrari's Leclerc wins 3rd F1 race of 2022 at Austrian GP after late issue
108.article_body: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc overcame a late throttle problem to win his third Formula One race of 2022 at Austrian Grand Prix on Sunday. Red Bull's Verstappen came second, while Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton completed the podium for the third race in a row. "I definitely needed that one...last five races have been incredibly difficult for myself and...the team," said Leclerc.

109.title: Suryakumar Yadav becomes 5th Indian to smash a hundred in men's T20I cricket history
109.article_body: Batter Suryakumar Yadav has become the fifth Indian to smash a hundred in men's T20I cricket history. The 31-year-old slammed his maiden T20I hundred off 48 deliveries against England in the third T20I in Nottingham. Suresh Raina, Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul and Deepak Hooda are the other four Indians to have slammed centuries in men's T20I cricket.

110.title: 3 people shoot dead Chhattisgarh couple after being denied alcohol
110.article_body: Three unidentified persons allegedly shot a couple to death in Chhattisgarh’s Jashpur district on Saturday night after they were allegedly denied alcohol, police said. According to the police, the unknown assailants reached the couple's residence and demanded traditional liquor made from the 'mahua' tree, which the couple refused to provide. The crime took place in Gaimunda Navapara village.

111.title: US-backed defence pact with Arab nations will threaten peace: Iran
111.article_body: Iran on Saturday warned that plans for a security alliance between the US, Israel and Arab nations to counter Iranian drones and missiles would jeopardise peace in the Middle East. US and Israel are reportedly seeking to lay the groundwork for an alliance with Arab nations, allowing the integration of air defence systems to counter Iranian missile and drone strikes.

112.title: YouTuber Gaurav shares permit to celebrate b'day in Noida metro after arrest, paid ₹38,000
112.article_body: After being released on bail, YouTuber Gaurav Taneja (Flying Beast), has shared a picture of a permission letter to celebrate his birthday inside a metro by Noida Metro Rail Corporation. The letter stated he paid nearly ₹38,000 to avail the facility from 2pm-3pm. He was arrested after thousands of people gathered at a Noida metro station to celebrate his birthday.

113.title: New COVID-19 Omicron subvariant found in China's Shanghai
113.article_body: A new subvariant of the COVID-19 Omicron virus has been found in China's Shanghai, a city official said on Sunday. Authorities identified an Omicron BA.5.2.1 case in the financial district of Pudong on July 8, Vice-Director of Shanghai's Health Commission Zhao Dandan said as per Reuters. It is linked to a case from overseas, Dandan has said.

114.title: Fan posts Kareena, Sujoy's pic; latter asks 'How do you get these'
114.article_body: Taking to Twitter, a fan posted a photo of actress Kareena Kapoor and director Sujoy Ghosh from 'The Devotion of Suspect X' sets. In the photo, Kareena wore a checked blue shirt as she stood next to Sujoy with her hand on his shoulder. Resharing the photo on his Twitter account, Sujoy wrote, "How do you get these photos?"

115.title: When will everyone stop asking: Shruti to fan asking about wedding
115.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan recently conducted an interactive question and answer session on social media. A social media user asked her, "When will you marry dear?" to which the actress responded, "When will everyone stop asking dear." She said along with the answer, "It was a big eye roll, for your information." Shruti is dating visual artist Santanu Hazarika.

116.title: Nicki Minaj says she's not fat but pregnant, later says she's not pregnant
116.article_body: Rapper Nicki Minaj conducted a Live session on Instagram and addressed the rumours of her pregnancy during the session. She said, "I did mean to tweet this. I'm not fat, y'all, I'm pregnant." The rapper read the congratulatory messages and corrected herself, saying, "I'm sorry, I think I said it wrong. I meant to say I'm not pregnant, I'm fat."

117.title: It was like time slowed down: Ranveer on first meeting with Deepika
117.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh spoke about his first meeting with his wife actress Deepika Padukone, saying it was at filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali's house. "It was almost like time had slowed down. That was it for me," Ranveer said. He added that "sparks were flying almost instantaneously". The couple got married in 2018 in an intimate ceremony in Italy's Lake Como.

118.title: 4th Sri Lankan Cabinet minister resigns amid ongoing economic crisis
118.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's ongoing economic crisis, Sri Lankan Minister of Investment Promotion, Dhammika Perera, resigned from his post on Sunday. Perera is the fourth Cabinet minister to step down after Harin Fernando, Manusha Nanayakkara and Bandula Gunawardana. This comes as Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe has also offered to resign, calling for the formation of an all-party government.

119.title: I was beaten by my parents after they found my love letter: Sai Pallavi
119.article_body: Actress Sai Pallavi revealed she was beaten by her parents after they found out about a love letter she had written to a boy when she was young. "I wrote a letter to a boy, it was in my childhood," she added. "Maybe when I was in my 7th standard. I was caught. My parents hit me hard," she said.

120.title: Djokovic beats Kyrgios to win 4th consecutive Wimbledon title, bags his 21st Grand Slam
120.article_body: World number three Novak Djokovic defeated world number 40 Nick Kyrgios in the men's singles final on Sunday to win his fourth consecutive Wimbledon title. Djokovic won the match with a scoreline of 4-6, 6-3, 6-4, 7-6(7-3) in three hours. With the victory, Djokovic has now taken his tally of Grand Slam titles to 21.

121.title: Happy to be defined by action, proud to be typecast: Vidyut Jammwal
121.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal has stated that he is happy to be defined by the action genre, adding that he feels proud of being typecast. "It's not an easy place to be in when you get typecast for being the best at what you do," the actor added. Vidyut was last seen in 'Khuda Haafiz: Chapter 2 – Agni Pariksha'.

122.title: I would've played Hooda instead of Iyer in 3rd T20I vs England: RP Singh
122.article_body: RP Singh said batter Deepak Hooda should've played instead of Shreyas Iyer in third T20I against England as the former was in form. "But by playing Iyer, you're trying to get him back in his form which is beyond my understanding. If I was...captain, I would've played Hooda," he added. Hooda has scored 184 runs in his last three T20Is.

123.title: U'khand MLA, 59 others get stuck as ropeway halts for 25 minutes; rescued
123.article_body: At least 60 people, including BJP MLA Kishore Upadhyay, were stuck after a ropeway at Surkanda Devi Temple in Uttarakhand stopped for 20 to 25 minutes due to a technical fault. All the passengers have come out safely and the ropeway is now running smoothly, Tehri Garhwal SSP Navneet Bhullar said. No passenger is trapped in the trolley, he added.

124.title: Congress' allegation that govt is snatching tribal rights holds no ground: Arjun Munda
124.article_body: Union Minister Arjun Munda reacted to Congress' criticism of Forest (Conservation) Rules, 2022, saying the allegation that the Centre is trying to snatch tribal rights has no ground. Munda said Congress was trying to divert attention from the fact that NDA's presidential candidate is a tribal lady. "The Centre is totally committed for upliftment of the tribal communities," he added.

125.title: Centre shouldn't adopt a 'touch-me-not' attitude: Ex-EAM Khurshid
125.article_body: Ex-External Affairs Minister Salman Khurshid on Sunday advised Centre against adopting a "touch-me-not" attitude, days after Germany criticised Alt News co-founder Mohammed Zubair's arrest. "If we don't want an adverse opinion we must show the best side of us [to other countries]," Khurshid said. India had called Germany's comments "uninformed" after latter condemned journalists' 'persecution'.

126.title: Goa Congress removes Michael Lobo as Leader of Oppn for planning defections to BJP
126.article_body: Goa Congress has removed Michael Lobo as the Leader of Opposition with immediate effect, AICC Goa In-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao announced on Sunday. "A conspiracy was hatched by some of our own leaders with BJP to see that the Congress party in Goa is weakened and to engineer defections," Rao said. He said Lobo and Digambar Kamat led the conspiracy.

127.title: England record their highest-ever total against India in T20I cricket
127.article_body: England put up a total of 215/7 in their 20 overs against India in the third T20I in Nottingham today. This is England's highest total against India in T20I cricket. This is the second time England touched 200-run mark against India in T20Is. England's previous highest T20I total against India had come on September 19, 2007, when they registered 200/6.

128.title: IndiGo technicians go on mass leave over poor hike after mass leave by crew: Reports
128.article_body: IndiGo's aircraft maintenance technicians at major hubs like Delhi and Hyderabad took mass leave recently to protest poor increment, reports said on Sunday. This came days after the airline's flights were delayed across the country as the crew reportedly took mass sick leave to attend Air India's recruitment drive. IndiGo announced 8% hike for crew and pilots after the incident.

129.title: Rybakina's Wimbledon win not a surprise: Kazakhstan tennis chief
129.article_body: Kazakhstan Tennis Federation President Bulat Utemuratov said Elena Rybakina's Wimbledon win was not a surprise. "Elena had been improving on a consistent basis and heading towards this type of success for some time," he added. Rybakina, who was born in Moscow, switched allegiance to Kazakhstan four years ago to gain more financial support. It was 23-year-old's maiden Grand Slam title.

130.title: Hope that India will continue to help Sri Lanka: Sonia Gandhi
130.article_body: Congress expressed solidarity with Sri Lanka and its people amid the ongoing crisis in the country. In a message, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi said, "We hope that India will continue to assist the people and government of Sri Lanka as they deal with the difficulties of the current situation." Congress urged the international community to extend help to Sri Lanka.

131.title: Ranveer Singh buys luxury quadruplex for ₹119 crore in Mumbai's Bandra: Report
131.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has bought a quadruplex apartment in Mumbai's Bandra West for ₹118.94 crore, as per documents accessed by IndexTap. Ranveer has purchased the apartment through his company Oh Five Oh Media Works. The sea-facing property on Mumbai's Bandstand area is spread across the 16th, 17th, 18th and 19th floors, with a total carpet area of 11,266 sq ft.

132.title: Govt requests BCCI to organise India-World XI match to celebrate 75th I-Day: Reports
132.article_body: The Indian government has requested the BCCI to organise India-Rest of the World XI match to commemorate 75 years of Indian independence, reports said. The government has sent a proposal to BCCI to organise the match on August 22, reports added. If finalised, the match is likely to be held at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi.

133.title: My 'Stranger...' co-stars & I've group where they send 'RoNance' memes: Natalia
133.article_body: 'Stranger Things' actress Natalia Dyer revealed how fans aren't only shipping her with characters of Steve and Jonathan but also Maya Hawke's Robin. "There are things about both Steve and Jonathan that Nancy...likes. I noticed...there's a lot of 'RoNance' shipping as well. I love Nancy having a girlfriend," she said. "We send each other memes...regarding that ship," she added.

134.title: Crypto exchange CoinFLEX sues user over $84-mn debt in Hong Kong
134.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange CoinFLEX has sued a customer in Hong Kong to recover an $84-million debt. The customer is reportedly cryptocurrency exchange Bitcoin.com's CEO Roger Ver. Earlier, CoinFLEX accused Ver of defaulting on a $47 million margin call. It has now said that the amount owned by the "individual" has increased after calculating the loss in liquidating his FLEX coin positions.

135.title: Punjab govt suspends 4 officers for constructing road during rains
135.article_body: The Punjab government has suspended four Public Works Department (PWD) officers for constructing a road amid heavy rains in the Hoshiarpur district. Sub-divisional engineer Tarsem Singh, along with three junior engineers, Vipan Kumar, Jasbir Singh and Parveen Kumar were suspended. The action was taken after a video went viral on social media, showing the workers constructing amid heavy rainfall.

136.title: 8-year-old boy seen sitting with 2-year-old brother's body on roadside in MP
136.article_body: An eight-year-old boy was seen sitting with his two-year-old brother's body on a roadside in Madhya Pradesh's Morena. The boy's father was looking for a vehicle to take them home after the hospital, where the two-year-old died during treatment, denied providing an ambulance citing unavailability, according to reports. They were reportedly provided an ambulance later after police intervention.

137.title: 3 killed, 4 injured as speeding truck hits van on Gujarat highway
137.article_body: Three persons died and four others sustained injuries in a collision between a speeding truck and a van on Pipali-Vataman Highway on the outskirts of Gujarat's Ahmedabad, police said. "The victims were traveling towards Kheda when the vehicle hit a truck in Dhandhuka area," an officer said. The condition of two of the injured passengers is said to be critical.

138.title: Arjun Bijlani and I are from same school, same football team: Ranbir
138.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor recently appeared on television show 'Ravivaar with Star Parivaar' hosted by Arjun Bijlani. A video going viral on social media shows Ranbir saying that he is from the school as Arjun, adding they played in the same house's football team together. "I'm proud of where we are right now and hope to always stay grounded," Ranbir said.

139.title: WI need to improve playing spin, swing: Pooran ahead of Bangladesh ODIs
139.article_body: Ahead of the three-match ODI series between West Indies and Bangladesh, West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said the team needs to have the right mindset and template for the format, adding they need to stick with it for a bit. Pooran further said that his team needs to improve the batting against spin and swing in the series.

140.title: PM Modi will meet same fate as Sri Lankan Prez Rajapaksa: TMC MLA
140.article_body: TMC MLA Idris Ali on Sunday said PM Modi will meet the same fate as Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, who was forced to leave his official residence after anti-government protesters stormed into his official residence. According to reports, his remarks came after West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee wasn't invited to the inauguration of the Sealdah Metro station in Kolkata.

141.title: Foster religious harmony by respecting other faiths: Karnataka CM
141.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday spoke of the importance of fostering religious harmony by respecting other faiths and added that establishing religious harmony was important for promoting social equality. He made the remark while speaking at a programme organised in memory of retired engineer-in-chief Dr L Shivalingaiah. Shivalingaiah was an inspiration for the youth, he said.

142.title: Heard's insurer refuses to partly pay $8mn owed to Depp, says she 'wilfully defamed' him
142.article_body: Amber Heard's insurance firm, New York Marine and General Insurance Co, has refused to cover a portion of the $8.35 million that the actress owes to her ex-husband Johnny Depp as part of their defamation trial settlement. The company said it wasn't liable to cover the damages for Amber due to her 'wilful', 'malicious' act of defaming Depp.

143.title: I've been criticised for doing 'Koffee with Karan' for so many years: Karan
143.article_body: Karan Johar said that he has been trolled for doing 'Koffee With Karan'. "I've been criticised for doing the show for so many years. So many blames and things have been attributed to me," he added. "If I'm not taking my own show seriously, why are you taking it...It's just meant to be fun and games," he said.

144.title: SEBI mulls bringing mutual fund units under insider trading rules
144.article_body: The SEBI has proposed to bring transactions in mutual fund units under insider trading regulations. Insiders would include those who have access to unpublished price-sensitive information and their immediate relatives. In the past, a few key personnel of a mutual fund redeemed their holdings in the schemes while in possession of "sensitive information", the SEBI noted in its discussion paper.

145.title: RBI to release norms for digital lending this month: Report
145.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will release guidelines for 'Buy Now, Pay Later' (BNPL) service and digital lending later this month, Financial Express reported. A circular could be out as early as next week, the report added. Last month, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said the regulator would introduce a framework to curb malpractices in the digital lending segment.

146.title: New forest rules are reformative, we're committed to protect Adivasi rights: Govt
146.article_body: After Congress criticised the Forest (Conservation) Rules, 2022, Union Minister Bhupender Yadav said the rules are reformative with an objective to streamline the process of approvals under the Forest Rights Act. He also called Congress' allegations that the rules will disempower tribals "ill-informed" and said, "Government under Narendra Modi ji remains committed to protecting Adivasis' rights."

147.title: Tiger Shroff shares fan art showing him as Dragon Ball Z's Goku
147.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff on Sunday took to Instagram Stories to share a fan's artwork which depicts him as the character Goku from Japanese anime television series 'Dragon Ball Z'. The fan shared the artwork on Instagram, writing, "@tigerjackieshroff As a Goku... In #ganapath Style. Kesa laga?" Tiger shared the art, along with the caption, "Love this thank [you] so much."

148.title: 76 dead in rain-related incidents in Maha so far this monsoon
148.article_body: Around 76 people have succumbed to rain-related incidents in Maharashtra during the ongoing monsoon season so far, a report by the state disaster management authorities said on Sunday. Of the total number of deceased, nine people died on Saturday, while as many as 125 animals have died since June 1 with rains lashing parts of the state.

149.title: Can't keep picking a player due to his past performances: Vaughan on Kohli
149.article_body: Speaking about Virat Kohli's place in the playing XI following his one off three balls against England in the second T20I, Michael Vaughan stated he's sure head coach Rahul Dravid and captain Rohit Sharma are not considering dropping him. "But you can't just keep picking a player because of what he has done in the past," he added.

150.title: 22-yr-old Mumbai man kills mother over property dispute, attempts suicide
150.article_body: A 22-year-old man from Mumbai's Mulund allegedly killed his mother on Saturday evening and later tried to end his own life. The man had allegedly left a suicide note, apologising to his father for his action, police said. Police added that the accused had committed the crime as he was depressed over some issues related to property.

151.title: 63 pilgrims from Maharashtra's Beed stranded in Amarnath rescued
151.article_body: As many as 63 pilgrims from Maharashtra's Beed who got stranded during the Amarnath pilgrimage were rescued and taken to Jammu, Srinagar and other places, an official has said. The pilgrims had got stranded near the Amarnath temple shrine. At least 16 people were killed and several others were reported missing in flash floods triggered by a cloudburst on Friday.

152.title: Drugs worth ₹10 cr seized from vehicle in Assam's Kamrup district
152.article_body: Police in Assam's Kamrup district seized drugs worth ₹10 crore from a mini-truck with an 'On Telecom Duty' sticker on Saturday night, a police official said. The seized drugs include five kgs of opium and 2,000 tablets, the official added. The occupants of the vehicle managed to escape and an operation is underway to locate them, he further informed.

153.title: Prithviraj apologises for 'Kaduva' dialogue on differently-abled children
153.article_body: Actor Prithviraj Sukumaran apologised for a dialogue in Malayalam film 'Kaduva' saying differently-abled children are born with their conditions due to the sins of their parents. He also shared director Shaji Kailas' statement in Malayalam which said that they only wanted to convey the villain's cruelty. Earlier, State Commissioner for Persons with Disabilities had issued a notice to the makers.

154.title: Govt unveils challenge to develop tech to reduce rotting of onions
154.article_body: The Centre has launched a Grand Challenge on Onion Storage for students, startups and corporates, asking them to develop technologies that reduce damage and rotting of onions. The challenge comes amid rising onion prices, and was launched by Department of Consumer Affairs on their Twitter handle. According to the Department, onion prices rose 2.3% in June from May.

155.title: 700 J&K youths recruited by terror groups in past 4.5 yrs: MHA data
155.article_body: As many as 700 youths from J&K have been recruited by terror groups in the past four-and-a-half years, according to Union Home Ministry statistics. As per the data, 82 foreign terrorists and 59 local terrorists were active in the union territory as on July 5, 2022. Security forces have eliminated 125 terrorists so far this year, the data further said.

156.title: Amarnath Yatra suspended from Jammu due to inclement weather conditions
156.article_body: The Amarnath Yatra has been suspended from Jammu due to inclement weather conditions, two days after a cloudburst near the shrine. No fresh batch was allowed to proceed from the city to the cave shrine. At least 16 people were killed and several went missing in the incident on July 8.

157.title: Pacer Richard Gleeson is a huge find for English cricket: Morgan
157.article_body: Calling Richard Gleeson's debut remarkable, ex-England captain Eoin Morgan said the 34-year-old pacer is a huge find for English cricket. "And one they can build towards the next World Cup and possibly the next 50-over World Cup next year," he added. Gleeson made his debut against India in second T20I in Birmingham on Saturday. He posted bowling figures of 4-1-15-3.

158.title: Grassroot Sainiks still with party despite betrayal: Aaditya
158.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday claimed the grassroot Shiv Sena workers were still with the organisation, despite "betrayal" by those whom the party trusted. "Those who are happy to leave should have the guts to face fresh elections. The doors of 'Matoshree' are open to all those who wish to return," he said.

159.title: PM Modi extends wishes to Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina on Eid
159.article_body: PM Narendra Modi conveyed his greetings to Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina on Eid-al Adha on Sunday. PM Modi recalled that the festival reminds us of the virtues of sacrifice and sharing. "Our ties help promote inclusive growth for all in both countries," the High Commission of India in Bangladesh quoted PM Modi as saying.

160.title: 3 people arrested for setting Sri Lankan PM's residence on fire
160.article_body: Sri Lankan authorities on Sunday arrested three people, including a 19-year-old person, for setting PM Ranil Wickremesinghe's private residence in Colombo on fire. While the extent of the damage isn't known, the house was replete with rare collection of books and Buddha statues, most of which were inherited, an official said. Wickremesinghe offered to resign as PM on July 9.

161.title: 7th accused in the Udaipur beheading arrested by the NIA
161.article_body: The seventh person accused of beheading Kanhaiya Lal in Udaipur has been arrested by the National Investigation Agency (NIA). The accused has been identified as 31-year-old Farhad Mohammad Sheikh, who is a resident of Udaipur. The NIA said that he is a close associate of Riyaz Attari, one of the main accused in the case.

162.title: Alia conducted mock interviews to prepare me for fatherhood questions: Ranbir
162.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor revealed his wife, actress Alia Bhatt conducted mock interviews to prepare him for all fatherhood questions. "I knew I’d be asked...(fatherhood) questions a lot as I promote 'Shamshera'. So I rehearsed a lot with Alia too," he added. "She was asking me, 'Ranbir, you're going to be a father. How do you feel about it?'" he said.

163.title: Local gangster arrested for shooting dead 40-yr-old builder in Delhi
163.article_body: The Delhi Police Crime Branch arrested a man days after a 40-year-old builder was shot outside his office in Delhi's Paschim Vihar. The accused, who is a member of a local gang, claimed that he killed the deceased for refusing to sell weapons to him. The deceased was a professional shooter and imported weapons illegally, according to the police.

164.title: India announce their playing XI for 3rd T20I against England, make 4 changes
164.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler won the toss and elected to bat first against India in the third T20I at Trent Bridge in Nottingham. India have made four changes to their playing XI, with Ravi Bishnoi, Umran Malik, Avesh Khan and Shreyas Iyer replacing Yuzvendra Chahal, Jasprit Bumrah, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Hardik Pandya. India lead the three-match series 2-0.

165.title: Mahindra may consider investing in an EV battery cell maker: CEO
165.article_body: Mahindra and Mahindra may consider investing in the EV battery-cell space if it needed to secure future supplies, CEO Anish Shah said. "Our intent is not to get into (manufacturing) batteries...There are people who do it...well," Shah stated. He added that Mahindra's deal with Volkswagen to source EV components will only meet its "short to medium term" battery needs.

166.title: Droupadi Murmu to visit Karnataka today to seek legislators' support
166.article_body: Droupadi Murmu, the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) candidate for the Presidential elections, will visit Karnataka on July 10, to seek support of the legislators in the state, as per BJP Vice President Nirmal Kumar Surana. Murmu, the former Jharkhand Governor, earlier visited Kolkata and Lucknow to campaign for support. She'll contest against opposition's presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha.

167.title: Govt shares pic of scenery forming the Indian flag, says 'nature flaunting Tricolour'
167.article_body: The Centre on Sunday shared a picture of a scenery forming the colours of the Indian National flag on Twitter under the 'Moments with Tiranga' campaign. "Nature flaunting the Tricolour," it wrote with the photograph provided by Sanjeev Kumar Singh. "Jhanda ooncha rahe hamara," a Twitter user reacted to the picture.

168.title: 2 Pune constables jump into stream, save man from being swept away
168.article_body: NCP MP Supriya Sule has shared a video showing two Pune Police constables jumping into a stream to save a man, who was being swept away by strong currents amid heavy rainfall in Maharashtra. "The courage shown by the two [policemen] is commendable! We are proud of the Maharashtra Police," she tweeted.

169.title: Over 10,000 fire incidents in Delhi till June 30 this year: DFS
169.article_body: Delhi witnessed over 10,350 fire incidents in the first six months of the year, claiming the lives of 60 people and injuring 395 others, the Delhi Fire Service (DFS) said. Director of DFS Atul Garg said that between January 1 and June 30, the department conducted 340 fire-fighting operations in commercial enterprises, 239 in industries, and 89 in JJ clusters.

170.title: Would tell Adani to go into sustainable, synthetic fuels: Safran CEO
170.article_body: Safran's CEO Olivier Andries told TOI that he would tell Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani to "go into sustainable and synthetic fuels". Andries added that the French aerospace engine manufacturer has partnered with French energy major Total, which announced a strategic partnership with Adani Group. He further said they are urging Total to move up production capacity of sustainable fuel.

171.title: Women secretly given 'date rape drug' at bash hosted by Germany's top political party
171.article_body: Several women were secretly given a 'date rape drug' at an event hosted by Germany's top political party and attended by the country's Chancellor Olaf Scholz. As per Germany's Social Democratic Party, at least nine women reported feeling dizzy and unwell after the summer bash that was also attended by lawmakers. The cases may possibly increase, the party spokeswoman said.

172.title: Dharma shares video celebrating 7 years of 'Baahubali: The Beginning'
172.article_body: The official Instagram handle of Dharma Productions shared a video on Sunday to celebrate seven years since the release of SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali: The Beginning'. The film features Prabhas, Rana Daggubati, Anushka Shetty and Tamannaah Bhatia. 'Baahubali: The Beginning' won the National Award for the Best Feature film in 2016 and director Rajamouli won the Filmfare Best Director-Telugu Award.

173.title: Will win a Grand Slam for sure: Jabeur after loss in Wimbledon final
173.article_body: Following her loss in Wimbledon final, world number two Ons Jabeur said she knows that she will come back and win a Grand Slam for sure. Notably, the 27-year-old became the first African woman and first Arab player to reach a Grand Slam final in the Open Era. World number 23 Elena Rybakina beat Jabeur 3-6, 6-2, 6-2 on Saturday.

174.title: It's difficult for star kids in beginning, for outsiders there's no baggage: Raima
