174.article_body: Actress Raima Sen said that initially when she joined the industry, people had a lot of expectations from her. "I was Moon Moon Sen's daughter. Being a star kid, people had...expected a lot out of me, they had already judged me, criticised me," she added. "It's...difficult for...star kids in...beginning. For a newcomer who's an outsider, there's no baggage," Raima said.

175.title: Amit ji did something very surprising for the film: Director R Balki on 'Chup'
175.article_body: Filmmaker R Balki said actor Amitabh Bachchan, who unveiled the teaser of his film 'Chup', did something very surprising for the film. "That's his way of telling me how much he liked the film. It is a very different thing to do, unlike common people," he added.  "He actually did something...beautiful, something which has never been done before," Balki said.

176.title: I used to think will I be able to perform with my artificial limb: Sudhaa
176.article_body: Speaking about starting her journey with her artificial limb, dancer and actress Sudhaa Chandran said, "In...past...I was thinking 'Will I be able to dance with my artificial limb?' And if I'm unable to perform to the expectations of the people, what would happen?" "I decided to concentrate on myself and exhibit my talent, not to prove it," she added.

177.title: Telangana shuts all educational institutions for 3 days amid rainfall alert
177.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday announced that all educational institutions in the state will remain closed for the next three days, in view of heavy rainfall. Rao has directed concerned authorities to stay alert and take necessary action in this regard. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert from Sunday night to Tuesday morning.

178.title: These are rumours: Cong leader on reports of Goa MLAs joining BJP
178.article_body: Goa Congress leader Michael Lobo has denied rumours of any party MLA joining the BJP. "These are all rumours. There's nothing as such. The Assembly session is starting and one rumour has to be spread by somebody or the other," he said. Three Goa Congress MLAs have reportedly skipped a party meeting.

179.title: New forest conservation rules will disempower tribals: Cong
179.article_body: The Congress on Sunday alleged that the new forest conservation rules will disempower crores of 'Adivasis' and others living in forest areas. "Once forest clearance is granted, everything else becomes a mere formality and almost inevitably, no claims will be recognised and settled," said Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh. New rules have been promulgated without any consultation, he added.

180.title: I want to have a daughter with my wife Alia Bhatt: Ranbir Kapoor
180.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor appeared on the show 'Ravivaar with Star Parivaar' with co-star Vaani Kapoor and took parenting tips from Anupamaa's Rupali Ganguly. In a short promo of the episode shared by the makers on Instagram, Ranbir interacts with the actors of 'Anupamaa' and can also be heard saying that he wants to have a daughter with his wife Alia Bhatt.

181.title: Man threatens Singapore PM on social media post about Abe, arrested
181.article_body: Authorities in Singapore have arrested a 45-year-old man for inciting violence after the accused posted a comment against PM Lee Hsien Loong on social media, reports stated on Saturday. The threat was reportedly found in the comments section of a post on ex-Japan PM Shinzo Abe's assassination. Police seized a laptop, a tablet and four mobile phones from the accused.

182.title: Psoriasis broke out over my body, I got psoriatic arthritis: Kardashian on Met Gala diet
182.article_body: American media personality Kim Kardashian has revealed that she suffered from severe "psoriatic arthritis" after following a diet to fit into the iconic Marilyn Monroe gown during the 2022 Met Gala event. "Psoriasis broke out over my body...so I couldn't really move my hands. I had to go to a rheumatologist who put me on a steroid," she stated.

183.title: SRK waves at fans from Mannat's balcony on Eid with son AbRam
183.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan came out to the balcony of his Mumbai residence Mannat to wish fans on the occasion of Eid-al-Adha on Sunday. The actor was accompanied by his younger son AbRam who was wearing a red T-shirt along with black pants. Pictures and videos of Shah Rukh and AbRam waving at fans are going viral on social media.

184.title: Indian startup funding declines 40% to $6.8 billion in Q2: Report
184.article_body: After three consecutive quarters of raising over $10 billion, the total funding in Indian startups declined 40% during the April-June quarter to reach $6.8 billion, a report by PwC India revealed. It said, "The decline can be attributed to a global slowdown...decrease in tech stock valuations, inflation and geopolitical instability." Early-stage deals comprised over 60% of total funding, it added.

185.title: 8 dead, 82 infected after Japanese Encephalitis outbreak in Assam
185.article_body: At least eight persons have died and 82 others have been infected with Japanese Encephalitis in flood-hit Assam in the past nine days. The state Health Department has asked district authorities to constitute District Rapid Response Teams (DRRT) by July 16 and keep a close watch on the situation. The National Health Mission has issued guidelines to tackle the situation.

186.title: They're running out of time: Vaughan on England after T20I losses vs India
186.article_body: After England fell behind 0-2 in the three-match T20I series following their loss in second T20I against India, Michael Vaughan said, "They haven't been doing well in this [T20I] format for a while." He added, "I don't think they're quite getting the combinations right. They're running out of time. It's the batting that just hasn't clicked for quite some time."

187.title: India releases statement as protestors burn Sri Lanka PM’s home, enter Prez's palace
187.article_body: India has released a statement after protestors in Sri Lanka's Colombo entered the Presidential palace and set PM Ranil Wickremesinghe's private residence on fire amid economic crisis. Stating that India is Sri Lanka's closest neighbour, the government said, "We have stood with the Sri Lankan people...India has extended this year itself an unprecedented support of over $3.8 billion."

188.title: Extremely heavy rainfall warning in several states tomorrow; IMD releases list
188.article_body: IMD has predicted isolated extremely heavy rainfall in Telangana, Gujarat, Maharashtra, Goa, coastal Karnataka, coastal Andhra Pradesh and Chhattisgarh on Monday. Red alert has been issued for several areas in these states. Meanwhile, very heavy rainfall is expected over Uttarakhand, Madhya Pradesh and interior Karnataka on Monday, according to IMD.

189.title: Japan votes for key polls days after ex-PM Abe's assassination
189.article_body: Japanese voters on Sunday cast their ballots in parliamentary election for the upper house, two days after ex-PM Shinzo Abe was assassinated while campaigning in Nara. Abe was shot while campaigning for a candidate from his Liberal Democratic Party. "We must never allow violence to suppress speech during elections, which are the foundation of democracy," Japan PM Fumio Kishida said.

190.title: Motherhood is an honour, it made me a complete artiste: Neeti Mohan
190.article_body: Singer Neeti Mohan has stated in an interview that motherhood is an honour, adding that she feels more complete as an artiste. The singer further said, "Motherhood has made me a better time manager, it has made me more productive." Neeti and her husband actor Nihaar Pandya welcomed their first child Aryaveer on June 2, 2021.

191.title: Dressing up not a crime: Assam CM as man dressed as Shiva gets arrested
191.article_body: After a man was arrested in Assam's Nagaon for allegedly hurting religious sentiments by playing Lord Shiva in a street play, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma tweeted, "Dressing up is not a crime unless offensive material is said." "Nukkad natak (street play) on current issues is not blasphemous...Appropriate order has been issued to Nagaon Police," Sarma added.

192.title: TN CM 'anti-Hindu', practices religion-based politics: BJP leader
192.article_body: BJP leader K Laxman on Sunday alleged that Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin was "anti-Hindu" and accused him of practising "religion-based politics". "Stalin who always opposes Hindutva should understand that religion is man's belief and faith and PM Narendra Modi has never linked religion with politics," he said. BJP has never done politics based on religion, he added.

193.title: Man's skull explodes after he lights firework on his head in US
193.article_body: A 43-year-old man, Pablo Ruiz, died in US' Texas after he lit a firework on top of his head recently. Investigators believe the firework exploded from the bottom of the tube and pierced the top of his skull. His friend, who witnessed the incident, said Ruiz had been drinking when he lit the mortar-style firework from his head.

194.title: Dalit boy gets ₹2.5cr scholarship to study in US, is son of daily wager from Bihar
194.article_body: A 17-year-old Dalit boy from Bihar has been awarded a ₹2.5 crore scholarship to study at the US' Lafayette College. Prem Kumar, who is the son of a daily wage worker, is one among only six students selected from across the world for the prestigious 'Dyer Fellowship'. Kumar will fly to Pennsylvania to study Mechanical Engineering and International Relations.

195.title: 53 Shiv Sena MLAs of Shinde, Thackeray factions get show-cause notices
195.article_body: Maharashtra Legislature Secretary has issued show-cause notices to 53 of the state's 55 Shiv Sena MLAs – 39 of Eknath Shinde-led faction and 14 of Uddhav Thackeray camp. Both factions have accused each other of defying the party whip during the Speaker's election and trust vote on July 3 and 4, respectively, seeking disqualification of the legislators from both sides.

196.title: Was once hit on by a girl in Goa, felt nice about it: Taapsee Pannu
196.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu revealed that she was once hit on by a girl in Goa. "I didn't realise it first...my friends told me...'she's hitting on you'," Taapsee said, adding, "I think I felt nice...because you always think...girls only find faults in other girls...So it was like she finds me nice, oh nice...I felt nice about it at that point."

197.title: It's sad Wimbledon didn't have 2nd semis, but Nadal knows his body: Djokovic
197.article_body: Reacting to Rafael Nadal pulling out of Wimbledon due to an abdominal injury, Novak Djokovic said it's sad that the tournament didn't have a second semi-final but Nadal knows "his body the best". He added, "I give Nadal a lot of credit for the way he fought and won...with that injury." Nadal had won quarter-final despite a seven millimetre tear.

198.title: UP govt taking measures to ban sale of meat in open on Kanwar Yatra routes
198.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government is taking measures to restrict the sale of meat in open along the routes fixed for Kanwar Yatra. The local, district and police administration are reaching out to meat traders to ensure this, said officials. This year, the Kanwar Yatra will take place after a gap of two years due to the COVID-19 outbreak.

199.title: Elon Musk is a bullsh*t artist, he's not going to buy Twitter: Donald Trump
199.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump called Tesla CEO Elon Musk a "bullsh*t artist" and claimed that Musk isn't going to buy Twitter. "He's got a pretty rotten contract, I looked at his contract," Trump said, referring to Musk's $44 billion merger contract to buy Twitter. On Saturday, Musk terminated the deal to acquire Twitter citing several reasons, including spam accounts.

200.title: Video shows protesters counting cash they found at Sri Lanka President's mansion
200.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media which purportedly shows anti-government protesters in Sri Lanka counting the cash that they claimed were found at the President's official residence. Notably, protesters who stormed President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's mansion on Saturday claimed to have recovered "millions of rupees" from his residence amid the country's worst economic crisis.

201.title: I find people asking me more about 'Koffee with...' than about my films: Johar
201.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, while speaking about his show 'Koffee With Karan', said, "I find people asking me more about 'Koffee With Karan' than about my movies, which I take as...compliment at that moment." "So while one part of me is elated, one part of me also needs to...make sure that the filmmaker...graph needs to move forward too," he added.

202.title: US Bitcoin mining firm Compass fires 15% staff, cuts exec pay by 50%
202.article_body: US-based Bitcoin mining company Compass Mining has fired 15% of its staff, Co-founders Thomas Heller and Paul Gosker announced. The company's senior employees and executive team have taken pay cuts of up to 50%, they added. This comes amid the falling price of Bitcoin. "Given recent market downturn...we had to take a hard look at our spend," the Co-founders said.

203.title: D-Mart owner Avenue Supermarts' profit jumps 490% to ₹680 cr in Q1
203.article_body: D-Mart owner and operator Avenue Supermarts reported a profit after tax (PAT) of almost ₹680 crore in Q1 of Financial Year 2023, after marking a jump of around 490% from ₹115.13 crore year-on-year. The Mumbai-based company also reported over 94% increase in its revenue from operations which came in at ₹9,806.89 crore.

204.title: Prabhas weighed 100 kg for 'Baahubali', had 8 meals a day: Trainer
204.article_body: Professional bodybuilder Laxman Reddy spoke about how Prabhas trained to play the role of Amarendra Baahubali in the 'Baahubali' films. "Prabhas weighed almost 100 kg," he said adding that the actor used to have eight meals a day. "In the evenings, we had weight training sessions, which included deadlifts, squats, bench press, and other rigorous exercises," said Reddy.

205.title: China fines Alibaba, Tencent for violating anti-monopoly rules
205.article_body: China imposed fines on Alibaba and Tencent along with other firms for failing to comply with anti-monopoly rules on disclosure of transactions. China's State Administration for Market Regulation released a list of 28 deals that violated the rules, out of which five involved Alibaba and 12 involved Tencent. The maximum potential fine in each case stands at $74,688, Reuters reported.

206.title: End voting rights for Muslims if they aren't allowed to vote: Khan
206.article_body: The right to vote for Muslims should be ended if community members are not allowed to exercise this right, said Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan. His remark came in the backdrop of bypolls for Rampur and Azamgarh Lok Sabha constituencies, during which Muslim voters were harassed and the total voting percentage in the Rampur district was only 32%, claimed Khan.

207.title: 'Agnipath' complements IAF’s long-term vision of ‘lean & lethal’ force: IAF chief
207.article_body: Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari said the 'Agnipath' scheme complements IAF's long-term vision of being a "lean and lethal" force with the best manpower. "We strongly believe that the men and women behind the machine make all the difference when it matters," he added. He said that 13 teams will take care of enrolment, employment, assessment and training of recruits.

208.title: Man cheats 200 people of ₹1.5 lakh each in Hyderabad, arrested
208.article_body: Hyderabad's Medipally Police have arrested a 35-year-old man accused of cheating 200 people of ₹1.5 lakh each on pretext of a business scam. According to police, the accused, identified as Adula Bala Swamy Goud, had sold machinery used to make cotton wicks to victims and promised to buy the products. Goud sold the machines to victims at ₹1.5 lakh each.

209.title: They enjoyed luxury, we suffered: SL woman as protesters occupy president's home
209.article_body: A 61-year-old handkerchief seller in Sri Lanka who entered the president's palace in Colombo after it was stormed by protesters on Saturday, said, "I've never seen a place like this in my life." She added, "They enjoyed super luxury while we suffered. We were hoodwinked." President and PM's houses have been occupied amid Sri Lanka's worst economic crisis since independence.

210.title: I think Rafael Nadal didn't want to face Kyrgios at 80%: McEnroe
210.article_body: Ex-world number one John McEnroe has said Rafael Nadal pulled out of Wimbledon 2022 because he didn't want to face Nick Kyrgios in the semi-final. "Nadal beat Taylor Fritz at 80%...but Kyrgios is dominating Wimbledon...do you really think Rafael wanted to play him at 80%? Something tells me he didn't want that," stated McEnroe. Nadal had suffered an abdominal tear.

211.title: 5 armed men barge into Haryana Cong MLA's house, beat up his cook
211.article_body: Five armed men allegedly barged into Congress MLA Kuldeep Vats' house in Haryana's Pataudi and beat up his cook, police said. Police added that a case has been registered against the accused. "They told me to warn the MLA that he should not make any comments against gangsters or he will face the fate as Sidhu Moosewala," the cook said.

212.title: Impartial judicial system biggest need for democracy: Nitin Gadkari
212.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said that an impartial and fair judicial system is the biggest requirement for a free and fair democracy. "During cabinet meetings...I often tell the law minister and prime minister that whatever the decision may be, it is the right of the judiciary to give the decision and it should not be influenced by anybody," he said.

213.title: Babul Supriyo appointed as Trinamool Congress' national spokesperson
213.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) appointed its MLA Babul Supriyo as the national spokesperson of the party. Taking to Twitter, the former union minister thanked TMC chief Mamata Banerjee and TMC's National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee and wrote, "Shall do my very best to live up to the responsibility entrusted upon me." In April, Supriyo won Ballygunge assembly seat on TMC's ticket.

214.title: 1Pay gets RBI's in-principle nod to operate as payment aggregator
214.article_body: Fintech startup 1Pay Mobileware has become one of the first companies in India to receive in-principle approval from RBI to operate as a payment aggregator. The company is backed by ex-Goldman Sachs MD Sanjiv Shah, and Sanjay Gaitonde. "1Pay is creating...payments platform for the unorganised sector that empowers them to accept and make digital payments," the firm's Co-founder Gaitonde said.

215.title: History-sheeter arrested for trying to extort ₹1 cr from Pune jeweller
215.article_body: A 28-year-old history-sheeter was arrested for allegedly trying to extort ₹1 crore from a jeweller in Pune district's Shirur. The accused made the extortion call using a phone he had stolen from a Pandharpur-bound Warkari. He allegedly said that he was calling from "DK Group" and threatened to kill the jeweller and his family members if the money wasn't given.

216.title: WhatsApp to let users sync chats across multiple smartphones: Report
216.article_body: According to a report by WABetaInfo, online messaging platform WhatsApp will soon let users sync their chats across multiple smartphones. This would allow users to use the same WhatsApp number or account on different smartphones without requiring to have an active internet connection on their primary phone, the report added. Currently, users can only sync chats on tablets and desktops.

217.title: SpiceXpress to be hived off from SpiceJet by August 1st week: CMD
217.article_body: SpiceJet CMD Ajay Singh has said banks and shareholders have given their approval to hive off cargo and logistics company SpiceXpress from SpiceJet airline. The bifurcation will take place by the first week of August, he added. This comes after SpiceJet said in August 2021 it was transferring its logistics business on a slump sale basis to its subsidiary SpiceXpress.

218.title: We have won Wimbledon: Russian tennis chief on Kazakh player Rybakina's win
218.article_body: Russian Tennis Federation (RTF) president Shamil Tarpishchev claimed credit for Kazakh player Elena Rybakina's women's singles title win at Wimbledon. "It's very nice. Well done Rybakina. We've won Wimbledon," Tarpishchev said. Rybakina, born and brought up in Russia's Moscow, switched nationalities to Kazakhstan in 2018. Notably, Russian players were banned from participating in Wimbledon.

219.title: Paintings, sculptures worth ₹40 crore seized by CBI in DHFL bank fraud case
219.article_body: The CBI seized paintings and sculptures worth ₹40 crore during its searches at three locations in connection with India's biggest banking fraud of ₹34,615 crore by DHFL. The seized artworks reportedly include paintings by famous artists Tyeb Mehta and Manjit Bawa, worth ₹27 crore and ₹7.7 crore, respectively. Promoters allegedly bought artworks worth ₹55 crore using diverted funds, CBI said.

220.title: Congress expresses solidarity with Sri Lanka and its people: Sonia Gandhi
220.article_body: A day after the protests against economic crisis reached a peak in Sri Lanka, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi on Sunday issued a statement, saying the Congress party expresses its solidarity with Sri Lanka and its people in this moment of grave crisis. "We hope that India will continue to assist the people and government of Sri Lanka," the statement read.

221.title: India's economy needs to grow 8-10% in 25 years: Singapore minister
221.article_body: Singapore's Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for Social Policies Tharman Shanmugaratnam said that India's economy must grow by 8-10% in the next 25 years to raise the average income of people across the country and create more jobs. Shanmugaratnam added that India needs to focus simultaneously not only on job growth but also on productivity.

222.title: Withdrawal rate falls as FPIs take out ₹4,000 crore in July so far
222.article_body: The pace of selling by foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) has declined as they withdrew over ₹4,000 crore from Indian equity markets in the first eight days of July. This comes after a net withdrawal of ₹50,203 crore in June, the highest net outflow since March 2020. Recently, the RBI announced several measures to boost foreign exchange inflows.

223.title: Hero MotoCorp CEO Munjal steps down as CII President-Designate
223.article_body: Hero MotoCorp Chairman and CEO Pawan Munjal has stepped down as President-Designate of the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) for 2022-23. Munjal cited domestic and global business commitments as the reason behind stepping down. The CII has elected TVS Group's R Dinesh as Munjal's replacement. ITC Chairman and MD Sanjiv Puri has been elected as Vice President.

224.title: Refrain from commenting about Musk's deal: Twitter to staff as it vows legal action
224.article_body: Twitter has asked its staff to not publicly comment about Elon Musk's $44 billion collapsed deal. Citing it as an ongoing legal matter, it said employees "should refrain from Tweeting, Slacking, or sharing any commentary" about the merger agreement. Meanwhile, Twitter Chairman Bret Taylor said the board will pursue legal action against Musk to enforce the merger.

225.title: Metallica pays tribute to 'Stranger Things' character Eddie Munson
225.article_body: Heavy metal band Metallica recently paid a tribute to television series 'Stranger Things' character Eddie Munson which is portrayed by actor Joseph Quinn. The series featured Eddie performing the band's song 'Master of Puppets' in an episode. Metallica posted a video on TikTok and Instagram recording a duet of performing the song along with the clip of Eddie's performance.

226.title: No pressure now, Rohit & Virat can take time to score: Parthiv on 3rd Eng T20I
226.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said the third and final T20I against England is a good opportunity for Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli to take time and score "big runs". "Rohit is looking good, but he's not able to convert 30s. As for Kohli, the runs are not coming," stated Parthiv. Kohli scored 1(3) in the second England T20I.

227.title: Seems someone is forcing him to go, hit: Ajay Jadeja on Kohli's dismissal
227.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's dismissal in second T20I against England, Ajay Jadeja said, "The way we saw Kohli today, it seems someone is forcing him to go and hit, we've not seen this for 15 years." Richard Gleeson removed Kohli(1) after the India batter hit the ball high in the air, with Dawid Malan taking the catch at backward point.

228.title: Delhi sets up control room to monitor plastic ban, ₹1 lakh fine
228.article_body: The Delhi Pollution Control Committee has set up a control room to monitor the implementation of the ban on single-use plastic items and will start fining those violating it from Monday, officials said. The action will include a fine of up to ₹1 lakh or a jail term of up to five years, under the Environment Protection Act, 1986.

229.title: Never thought my career was over: Bhuvneshwar on facing injuries
229.article_body: India bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar recalled his injury woes before making his India comeback and said he never thought his career was over. "I was working with the physios, trainers...doing my thing...when you're out of the game you're never confident," he stated. "Luckily...(I'm) playing for India again," he added. Bhuvneshwar was Player of the Match in the second T20I versus England.

230.title: India sends 44,000 MT urea to Sri Lanka to curb food crisis
230.article_body: India on Sunday handed more than 44,000 metric tonnes (MT) of urea to Sri Lanka amid latter's economic crisis. The assistance, which is part of India's credit line to the country, is aimed at supporting Sri Lankan farmers, the Indian High Commissioner to Sri Lanka said. Over 6 million Sri Lankans are facing food insecurity amid inflation, UN has said.

231.title: 3 arrested for spreading 'fake news' on Jagannath Rath Yatra via YouTube
231.article_body: Three youths were arrested from Gujarat for allegedly spreading "fake news" on YouTube channels about an attack on Jagannath Rath Yatra. The social media monitoring cell of Cyber Crime Branch came across YouTube channels, while keeping a watch on various platforms on July 2. There was an attempt to disturb peace and social harmony through YouTube channels, the police said.

232.title: Rare 'rain of animals' witnessed in Telangana's Jagtial; video surfaces
232.article_body: Residents of Telangana's Jagtial town witnessed a rare weather phenomenon as fish rained from the sky. 'Rain of animals' is a phenomenon that occurs when small water animals like frogs, crabs, and fish are swept up in waterspouts or drafts that occur on the surface of the earth. They are then rained down at the same time as the rain.

233.title: 6 killed as rockets hit apartment building in Ukraine's Donbas
233.article_body: At least six people were killed and over 30 people are feared trapped after Russian rockets hit a five-storey residential building in Chasiv Yar, a city in Ukraine's Donbas region, regional governor has said. The strike, which reportedly took place on Saturday, comes even as Russia denies deliberately attacking civilians. Notably, several regions of Donbas are now under Russian control.

234.title: Blessings of Goddess Kali are always with India: PM Modi
234.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while addressing the centenary celebrations of Swami Atmasthananda on Sunday, said the blessings of Goddess Kali are always with the country. This comes amid a controversy over TMC MP Mahua Moitra's remarks on Goddess Kali, following which BJP filed several police complaints against her. "To me, Kali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting Goddess," Moitra had earlier said.

235.title: Protesters enact WWE on Sri Lanka Prime Minister's bed, video goes viral
235.article_body: A video has gone viral showing protesters enacting WWE on a bed at Sri Lanka Prime Minister's residence. In the video, several intruders can be seen imitating wrestling moves, while others can be seen cheering them up. Sri Lanka Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe on Saturday announced that he is resigning from his post amid the economic crisis in the country.

236.title: BJP trying to poach our MLAs, intimidate them: AICC Goa in-charge
236.article_body: AICC Goa in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao on Sunday said, "All the MLAs of Congress party are intact but BJP is trying to poach our MLAs and intimidate them." Furthermore, he said, "Yesterday we had a CLP meeting in Goa…All our MLAs are intact." Meanwhile, Goa Congress leader Michael Lobo refuted the "rumours" that few Congress leaders are joining BJP.

237.title: Film initiative started by TN govt, movies to be shown in 13,000 schools
237.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government has launched an initiative to screen films in government schools. In the state's 13,210 schools, a nodal teacher would facilitate the process. The nodal teacher has to prepare a synopsis of the film and ensure the screening meets all criteria. "The government had initiated counselling programmes to improve [kids'] mental health," Minister for School Education said.

238.title: When he collared me & asked why I'm not making Paani: Shekhar on pic with Cruise
238.article_body: Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur has shared a throwback picture of himself with Tom Cruise from the time the actor visited India in 2011. Sharing the picture, Shekhar wrote, "When #TomCruise collared me and asked...why I'm not making #Paani." The picture was reportedly clicked at a party organised by Anil Kapoor while Tom was in India to promote 'Mission Impossible: Ghost Protocol'.

239.title: No justification provided: Pak's Imad Wasim on losing central contract
239.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Imad Wasim said no justification has been given to him as to why he didn't get a central contract from Pakistan Cricket Board. "Reasons are given to me, but I'm unsatisfied with them," he added. "One reason given to me was regarding the positive influence on the team. I don't think I have a negative influence," he stated.

240.title: Pune to have normal water supply till July 26: PMC
240.article_body: PMC has decided to continue its normal supply till July 26 after water storage in the four dams supplying water to Pune increased to over 7 TMC, officials said on Sunday. PMC had previously said it will start an alternate day water supply from July 4 to July 11 because of the deficit rain in June.

241.title: Man threatens IAS officer over son-in-law's transfer from B'luru; held
241.article_body: A man has been arrested from Bengaluru for allegedly making threat calls to IAS officer Munish Moudgil over his driver's transfer to Kolar. Moudgil's driver is the son-in-law of the accused. The accused had posed as Karnataka Excise Minister K Gopalaiah's personal secretary and threatened to transfer the officer from his present department and started shouting at him.

242.title: Ebden and Purcell win Wimbledon men's doubles title in 4 hours 11 minutes
242.article_body: Australia's Matt Ebden and Max Purcell defeated defending champions Mate Pavic and Nikola Mektic of Croatia 7-6(7-5), 6-7(3-7), 4-6, 6-4, 7-6(10-2) to win their first Grand Slam men's doubles title at Wimbledon on Saturday. They won the final in four hours 11 minutes. Ebden and Purcell saved a total of eight match points on the way to winning the title.

243.title: Thanks Farah Ma for having faith in me when no one did: Deepika
243.article_body: Filmmaker Farah Khan recently took to Instagram Stories to share an advertisement of actress Deepika Padukone for a luxury brand in Bangkok, writing, "Looking good baby." Deepika shared the post on her story, writing, "Thank you Ma! YOU had faith in me when no one else did." Deepika made her Bollywood debut in Farah's 2007 film 'Om Shanti Om'.

244.title: Team India have got something going on at the right time: Vaughan
244.article_body: After India's win in the two T20Is against England, ex-cricketer Michael Vaughan said, "It's the first time I'm seeing India thinking that they can carry on with this mindset, aggression and skill-set with the ball in hand." He added, "They've got something going on at the right time." India were 89/5 but scored 170/8 in the second T20I against England.

245.title: Protesters work out in presidential palace gym in Sri Lanka, videos go viral
245.article_body: Protesters in Sri Lanka were seen crowding the gym at the presidential palace in Colombo after storming the property on Saturday. Videos from inside the gym, showing protesters working out on treadmills and lifting weights, have gone viral online. Footage from inside the palace has also shown protesters in the swimming pool, kitchen and other areas.

246.title: 17-yr-old Navi Mumbai boy drowns while swimming in well with friends
246.article_body: A 17-year-old boy from Navi Mumbai's Digha died after drowning while swimming in a well in the Kargil Hill area of Kalwa East. "The deceased...had gone swimming in the well along with his six friends," an official said. According to the official, the boy was unable to gauge the depth of the well, which is approximately 30-35 feet.

247.title: PT assistant inappropriately touches, molests 14 girls in school in Pune; held
247.article_body: An 18-year-old physical training assistant has been arrested in Pune for allegedly molesting 14 girls from Class 8 to 10 during PT sessions held inside school, police said. Officers said the man has been accused of inappropriately touching the girls, passing inappropriate comments and also threatening them. The school principal informed the police after girls' complaints.

248.title: Ritesh shares pics with Salman as he finishes filming directorial debut 'Ved'
248.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Ritesh Deshmukh shared a series of pictures with actor Salman Khan on social media as he finished filming his Marathi directorial debut 'Ved'. He wrote, "I have no words to express my gratitude for the grace and kindness [Salman] has shown towards (my wife) Genelia (Deshmukh) and me." Salman will be making a cameo appearance in the upcoming film.

249.title: I'm worried Hardik will be expected to bowl 10 overs in ODIs: Manjrekar
249.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has said he's not sure if it's a "great call" to include all-rounder Hardik Pandya in the ODI squad for the England series. "I'm a little worried if Hardik plays 50-overs cricket and is expected to bowl 10 overs...ODI [are] tough," stated Manjrekar. Hardik picked a wicket and scored 12(15) in the second T20I against England.

250.title: Man demands ₹1 cr from Pune RTO officer to withdraw case; arrested
250.article_body: A man has been arrested for allegedly demanding ₹1 crore from Regional Transport Officer (RTO) to withdraw a police complaint lodged in 2019. Six RTO officials and staffers were booked back then for their alleged role in transferring a truck on forged documents. The accused had demanded the amount to withdraw the complaint.

251.title: Bag with coins, God idol & jewellery found outside BJP leader's Mumbai home
251.article_body: The Mumbai Police found a bag full of coins, cash, idol of God and jewellery outside the house of the Bhartiya Janata Party leader Prasad Lad. Officials told news agency ANI that the bag was dropped off in front of Lad's house by a man around 5:30 am on Sunday. Reports said motive of act is yet to be established.

252.title: Mind-blowing to see people cheering after my crash at Austrian GP: Hamilton
252.article_body: F1 driver Lewis Hamilton has reacted to fans cheering after he crashed during the qualifying race at the Austrian Grand Prix. "It's just mind-blowing that people would do that, knowing how dangerous our sport is...You should never cheer someone's downfall or someone's injury," he stated. The Mercedes driver will begin the race on Sunday in eighth place.

253.title: Heart cried slightly: Aakash on Kohli replacing Hooda in 2nd T20I vs Eng
253.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Aakash Chopra, speaking about Virat Kohli replacing Deepak Hooda in the second T20I against England, has said, "The heart cried for Hooda slightly because he has consistently done well." "I am sure Hooda's name is there in the ODI series against West Indies...he'll play there but it is not possible to not feel for him," he added.

254.title: Our villages showed they cannot only bring change but also lead change: PM
254.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday addressed the Natural Farming Conclave and said our villages have shown that they cannot only bring a change but also lead the change. "The extraordinary success of the Digital India Mission is the country's reply to those people who used to say that it's not easy to bring change to villages," he added.

255.title: Hyd man arrested for issuing death threats to BJP MP Pragya Thakur
255.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Police have arrested a Hyderabad resident for allegedly threatening BJP MP Pragya Singh Thakur last month, an official said. The accused, identified as Sheikh Nazir, was nabbed by authorities at the Delhi airport on Thursday and then taken to Bhopal for questioning. Nazir had allegedly called Thakur from an international number and issued death threats to her.

256.title: Abe could've survived, there was a life-saving gap between two shots: Mahindra
256.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to claim that former Japan PM Shinzo Abe could have survived the assassination. "There was a potentially life-saving gap until the second shot. Shouldn't his security have jumped on Abe...and covered him," Mahindra asked. Retired IPS officer Muktesh Chander replied, "I have been in-charge of security...of 5 different PMs and ex-PMs...I definitely agree."

257.title: Man held for trying to kill woman who denied him space in Delhi's footpath
257.article_body: A 42-year-old man has been arrested for trying to kill a woman after she refused to leave space for him to sleep on a footpath, the Delhi Police said. The police rushed to the spot after they received information that a woman is lying unconscious with head injury near Lady Hardinge Hospital's gate number three, DCP Amrutha Guguloth said.

258.title: Assam man dressed as Lord Shiva for street play on fuel rate arrested
258.article_body: A man who played Lord Shiva in a street play in Assam's Nagaon has been arrested for allegedly hurting religious sentiments. The arrested man was protesting against rising fuel prices and unemployment through the street play, news agency ANI reported. Police said that he will be presented in the court, while two others are yet to be caught.

259.title: Protesters find high-security bunker in President's palace in Sri Lanka; video viral
259.article_body: Protestors in Sri Lanka found a high-security bunker in the Presidential palace in the country, a video of which is going viral on social media. Video shows several people entering the bunker. Earlier, videos and pictures from the palace showed protesters on President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's bed, jumping in the pool and taking a shower among other things.

260.title: Novak Djokovic, Nick Kyrgios' Instagram chat ahead of Wimbledon final goes viral
260.article_body: Novak Djokovic and Nick Kyrgios' chat on Instagram ahead of their Wimbledon final went viral. Kyrgios asked Djokovic on Instagram Stories if they were friends now, to which Djokovic responded, "If you are inviting me for a drink or dinner, I accept. PS: Winner [of the final] pays." Kyrgios then replied, "Deal, let's go to a nightclub and go nuts."

261.title: IFS officer shares pic of fake appointment letter people received; issues warning
261.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan has shared a picture of fake appointment letter of Indian Forest Service received by some people. "Friends some people are getting such appointment letters. Please don't deposit any fees. They are fake. Even reading few lines will make you understand," he warned people. "Shocking. They are also using fake stamp and seal," a Twitter user reacted.

262.title: Anupam wraps up 'Kaagaz 2' shoot in Lucknow, thanks UP CM Yogi Adityanath
262.article_body: Anupam Kher has completed shooting for his upcoming film 'Kaagaz 2' in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh. He took to Instagram on Sunday to share the news and thanked UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath for "facilitating [the] shoot so smoothly". "It was an absolute pleasure to shoot here," he further wrote. Anupam also shared some pictures from the sets.

263.title: Bobby Deol, Kajol hold special screening as 'Gupt' completes 25 years
263.article_body: Actors Bobby Deol and Kajol reunited on Saturday in Mumbai for a special screening of their 1997 film 'Gupt: The Hidden Truth' which completed 25 years of release. The film also stars Manisha Koirala who was not seen at the screening. Kajol received the Best Actor in a Negative Role award for the film at the 1998 Filmfare Awards.

264.title: 66,000 liquor bottles worth ₹2 cr seized, destroyed in Andhra's Kurnool
264.article_body: Special Enforcement Bureau (SEB) seized and destroyed 66,000 liquor bottles worth ₹2 crore, in 593 cases registered in 2021-2022, in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool. The SEB said that the liquor bottles were destroyed on the road near the railway bridge on the way from Panchalingala village to Tandrapadu village in Kurnool.

265.title: School teacher molests woman inside Delhi metro station's lift, booked
265.article_body: A 33-year-old school teacher was arrested from Delhi's IP Extension metro station for allegedly molesting a female teacher from a different school. Police said the accused had been harassing her for a long time. The incident took place when he allegedly followed her inside a lift, touched her inappropriately and threatened to kill her if she told anyone about it.

266.title: Boy seen riding horse with Swiggy delivery bag is a horse couturier: Swiggy
266.article_body: Swiggy said that it has identified the boy who was seen riding a horse with its delivery bag in a viral video shot in Mumbai. Saying that the 17-year-old wasn't a delivery executive, Swiggy added, "He's a horse couturier i.e. he takes care of dressing horses for wedding[s]." He was carrying accessories for the horse in the bag, it added.

267.title: Musk talked about Mars, avoided discussing Twitter deal at Sun Valley: Report
267.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk avoided discussing the $44 billion collapsed Twitter deal at Sun Valley, as per people who attended the conference. Musk spent most of his time discussing colonising Mars and the importance of boosting the birth rate on Earth, they said. Sun Valley Conference is an annual media finance conference hosted by private investment firm Allen & Company.

268.title: India supportive of Sri Lanka, no refugee crisis right now: Jaishankar
268.article_body: A day after the protests against economic crisis reached a peak in Sri Lanka, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that the Indian government has always been supportive of the neighbouring country, adding that there is no refugee crisis now. "They are right now working through their problems, so we have to wait and see what they do," he added.

269.title: Sam Wilson will be Captain America: Evans on rumours of returning to MCU
269.article_body: Chris Evans has dismissed rumours of him returning to the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) as Captain America. The actor was reacting to a tweet by The Hollywood Reporter which said it remains "unclear" if he'd return for the fourth instalment of 'Captain America'. "Sam Wilson is Captain America," Evans wrote. Sam Wilson is played by Anthony Mackie in the MCU.

270.title: Nearly 10.05 mn people use digital certificates for pensions: Data
270.article_body: Nearly 10.05 million people, including private citizens and ex-government employees, use digital life certificates to claim pension payments, according to official data. Out of the 10 million, 2.4 million are government pensioners, the data stated. Launched in 2014, digital certificates are verified by Unique Identification Authority of India, which sends it to bank that disburses the pensions.

271.title: Partnership in bowling important: RP Singh on Bumrah & Bhuvneshwar
271.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh said partnership in bowling is "very important" just like in batting. "Bumrah...Bhuvneshwar were a...successful pair a few years back, but their alliance was broken due to injuries (to Bhuvneshwar)," he added. "[In the second T20I versus England], they dismissed key batters in the first six overs...the reward for it was a 49-run win," he concluded.

272.title: I like the idea of Pant opening for Team India: Sehwag
272.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag, while congratulating Team India for their T20I series win against England, said he liked the idea of Rishabh Pant opening the batting in the second T20I. "Fantastic effort by Indian bowlers...like the idea of Pant opening. Congratulations on the wonderful series win," tweeted Sehwag. Pant scored 26(15) alongside Rohit Sharma.

273.title: 14 killed in mass shooting in a bar in South Africa, police call it 'random firing'
273.article_body: As many as 14 people were killed in a mass shooting in a bar in South Africa's Johannesburg's Soweto township. The police stated that a group of men arrived in a minibus taxi and opened fire. Calling it a "random firing", the police stated that a high caliber firearm was used. Three people have also been critically injured.

274.title: EPFO may approve new system to pay pension to over 73 lakh beneficiaries in one go
274.article_body: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) will consider and approve a proposal for setting up a central pension disbursal system in its upcoming meeting to credit pensions to over 73 lakh beneficiaries' bank accounts in one go across India. Currently, over 138 regional offices of the EPFO disburse pensions in their region separately at different times or days.

275.title: Protesters claim to find millions of rupees at Sri Lanka President's residence: Report
275.article_body: The anti-government protesters who stormed Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's residence have claimed to have recovered millions of rupees inside his mansion, according to reports.  A video is being shared on social media showing the protesters counting the currency notes that were unearthed. The recovered money was said to be handed over to the security units, the Daily Mirror reported.

276.title: Iran has escalated uranium enrichment at Fordow plant: IAEA report
276.article_body: Iran has increased the enrichment of uranium through advanced machineries at its underground enrichment facility in Fordow, UN's atomic watchdog International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has said in a confidential report accessed by Reuters on Saturday. According to the report, the new setup allows for quicker and easier switch between the enrichment levels of uranium.

277.title: India among favourites for T20 WC 2022: Afridi after 2nd T20I vs Eng
277.article_body: Following India's 49-run win over England in the second T20I, ex-Pakistan skipper Shahid Afridi praised the Indian cricket team and said they played outstanding cricket. On Twitter, he wrote, "Really impressive bowling performance, they'll surely be one of the favourites for the T20 World Cup in Australia." India have taken an unassailable lead in the three-match T20I series against England.

278.title: We discussed Sourav Ganguly's biopic before 'Shabaash...': Srijit Mukherji
278.article_body: 'Shabaash Mithu' director Srijit Mukherji has said that being a cricket fan, he had been trying for a cricket biopic for a long time. "We were discussing possibilities with Sourav Ganguly for the longest time, but that didn't materialise," Srijit stated. 'Shabaash Mithu' is a biopic of ex-India women's captain Mithali Raj, who will be played by actress Taapsee Pannu.

279.title: Muslim society should oppose such incidents vigorously: RSS on Udaipur murder
279.article_body: RSS leader Sunil Ambekar on Saturday condemned the killing of a tailor, Kanhaiya Lal, in Udaipur, saying that the Muslim society should come forward and oppose such incidents "vigorously". "The Hindu society is responding in a peaceful and constitutional way. The Muslim society is also expected to oppose such an incident. Some intellectuals have opposed it," he added.

280.title: She taught me a lot of things, had ringmaster's precision: Urmila on Saroj
280.article_body: Urmila Matondkar, in a recent episode of 'Dance India Dance Super Moms', recalled working with Saroj Khan and said that she learned a lot of things from the late choreographer. "[When]...I started working with Saroj Khan ji, I saw the ringmaster's precision in her and she taught me a lot of things," she said. Saroj passed away in July 2020.

281.title: Really ashamed, mafia came despite police presence: Assam CM on man's death
281.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said he is "really ashamed" after death of Vineet Bagaria who died by suicide due to mafia in state's Dibrugarh area. "Mafia came here despite [police] presence. I've never been more ashamed in my life that such incident could happen when I am serving as the chief minister...I apologise to his parents," he added.

282.title: Team India were a little bit over-par: England's Richard Gleeson
282.article_body: England pacer Richard Gleeson, who made his international debut for England in their 49-run defeat against India, said the Rohit Sharma-led side was a "little over-par". He added, "India started well with the ball...that's always going to put [you] on the back foot...that can be the way T20 goes at times." Gleeson picked three wickets in his four overs.

283.title: Being a parent is tough, I'm learning how to become a better father: Anil
283.article_body: Anil Kapoor has said being a parent is very tough, adding he's learning how to become a better father. "There are many drawbacks in me. I'm not the right person to tell...how to become...better parent," he added. Anil further said he cannot be strict with his children, adding, "You can make...kids do better things with love...You need to have patience."

284.title: CBI, I-T dept raid ex-NBCC officer Mittal's Noida house, seize ₹2 cr
284.article_body: The CBI and Income Tax Department conducted a raid at the residence of DK Mittal, a former National Buildings Construction Corporation (NBCC) officer, in Noida on Saturday. According to ANI, more than ₹2-crore cash and jewellery were recovered from his residence. The CBI has registered a disproportionate assets case against his known sources of income.

285.title: 'Shaktimaan' movie to be helmed by 'Tanhaji' director Om Raut: Report
285.article_body: 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' director Om Raut will reportedly be directing 'Shaktimaan'. Sony Pictures International Productions, who bought the film adaptation rights of 'Shaktimaan', will be backing the VFX-heavy project. Earlier, it was reported that actor Ranveer Singh will be playing the Indian superhero in the film. Om is currently working on Prabhas-starrer 'Adipurush'.

286.title: This is a fight for Mumbai: Aaditya Thackeray at Aarey protest site
286.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray, who joined the protest opposing metro car shed project in Aarey colony today, said that the protest is a fight for Mumbai and fight for life. "We fought for forest and to protect our tribals," he added. During our tenure, we had proposed construction to be turned into a veterinary hospital for jungle, Thackeray said.

287.title: M-cap of 8 of top 10 most valued firms jumps ₹1.81 lakh crore in past week
287.article_body: Eight of the 10 most valued domestic firms together added ₹1,81,209.89 crore in market valuation last week with Hindustan Unilever emerging as the biggest gainer. While HUL added ₹50,058.05 crore, taking its valuation to ₹5,86,422.74 crore and ICICI Bank's valuation jumped ₹35,956.8 crore to reach ₹5,25,656.96 crore. Reliance Industries and Tata Consultancy Services were among the laggards.

288.title: Sri Lankan Army chief says opportunity to resolve crisis available, urges calm
288.article_body: Sri Lankan Army chief General Shavendra Silva said that an opportunity to resolve the current political crisis in a peaceful manner is now available. He also sought public's support to maintain peace in the nation. His statement came after the violence that took place at Galle Face and Fort and near the private residence of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

289.title: Virat Kohli does bhangra while fielding in the deep, video goes viral
289.article_body: A video of Team India batter Virat Kohli doing bhangra while fielding in the deep during the second T20I against England at Edgbaston in Birmingham has gone viral. In the video, the crowd can be heard singing and beating the dhol with Kohli dancing. India defeated England by 49 runs in the match to take an unassailable 2-0 series lead.

290.title: Old video of 21-yr-old Rishi Sunak saying he doesn't have working-class friends goes viral
290.article_body: An old video of 21-year-old Rishi Sunak saying he does not have working-class friends has resurfaced and gone viral after he announced his candidacy for the UK Prime Minister. "I have friends who are aristocrats, I have friends who are upper-class, I have friends who are, you know, working-class. Well, not working class," Sunak said in a 2001 BBC documentary.

291.title: Man who helped in supplying weapons for Moosewala’s murder attacked in jail
291.article_body: Satbir Singh from Amritsar, who was arrested for supplying illegal weapons that were suspected to have been used to kill Sidhu Moosewala, was attacked inside Ludhiana Central Jail. "He said that he is unable to identify [the attackers]. He has suffered minor injuries on his head and legs. We have started investigation to identify the attackers," an official said.

292.title: Tar balls with garbage wash ashore the coast of Juhu beach in Mumbai
292.article_body: Tar balls with garbage washed ashore the coast of Juhu beach in Mumbai, reports said. This comes amid heavy rains that have been lashing Mumbai as part of ongoing monsoon season in the city. Meanwhile, amid rainfall in the city, a campaign against potholes has been started in Mumbai and 'Get Well Soon' cards are being sent to BMC chief.

293.title: If I had to pick a T20 side, Virat wouldn't be there: Ajay Jadeja
293.article_body: Former India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has said Team India captain Rohit Sharma has to take a call about the team's approach in upcoming games. Jadeja further suggested that Rohit will probably have better options than Virat Kohli if they want to follow this attacking template. "If I had to pick a T20 side, Virat probably wouldn't be there," stated Jadeja.

294.title: When I looked for projects, people were busy getting on magazine covers: Urmila
294.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar said that she was always too busy being an actor than being a star. "Running to parties and doing PR stunts was never on my list. Till date, I have no PR...When I was looking for projects that were a notch higher than my previous work, people were busy getting on magazine covers," she added.

295.title: Ensure cows are not slaughtered on Bakri Eid: Maha Speaker to DGP
295.article_body: Maharashtra Assembly Speaker Rahul Narwekar wrote to state DGP, Rajnish Seth, instructing him that the police should ensure that cows are not slaughtered on the day of Bakri Eid on July 10. Earlier, Karnataka Animal Husbandry Minister Prabhu Bhamla Chavan urged people to not slaughter cattle for Bakri Eid and warned stern action against offenders.

296.title: Jacqueline shares 1st poster of her H'wood film, says 'Proud to be part of it'
296.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez has shared the first poster of her upcoming Hollywood film. The anthology, titled 'Tell It Like a Woman', has been directed by eight women filmmakers from different parts of the world. "So proud to be part of this extraordinary effort by the entire team of 'Tell It Like a Woman'," Jacqueline wrote while sharing the poster.

297.title: Will try to bring 'achhe din' in lives of common citizens: Maharashtra CM
297.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Saturday said he will use his CM’s post to give justice to the people of the state and will try to bring "achhe din" in common citizens' lives. "We will take forward the Hindutva of Balasaheb and teachings of Dharmveer Anand Dighe," Shinde added. He was addressing a public gathering in Pune.

298.title: Mumbai man gets cheated of ₹4.68 lakh by woman he befriended on dating app
298.article_body: A 23-year-old Mumbai-based man filed a complaint with Bhandup Police claiming that the woman he befriended through a dating app extorted ₹4.68 lakh from him. According to the victim, the woman made a video call to him and got indulged in obscene activity. The woman allegedly recorded the whole act and later threatened the man to share it on internet.

299.title: I was the first boy in my family to pass Class 10, got 53.4%: Ranbir Kapoor
299.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, in a recent interview, revealed that he was the first boy in his family to pass Class 10. He revealed that he got 53.4%. "When my results came, my family was so happy that they kept a huge party for me. They had no expectations," the actor, who will be next seen in 'Shamshera', added.

300.title: Arjun Rampal shares pics with girlfriend Gabriella on four-year anniversary
300.article_body: Actor Arjun Rampal took to Instagram to share a few pictures with his girlfriend Gabriella Demetriades to mark four years of their relationship. "Happy 4th to us my love. Thank you for all the beautiful memories. To making many more. #4thanniversary," he wrote. Several celebrities, including Bobby Deol, Abhishek Kapoor and Divya Dutta, posted congratulatory comments on the post.

301.title: Due to political opportunism, rift being created between communities: Amartya Sen
301.article_body: A rift is being created between communities on account of “political opportunism”, Nobel laureate Amartya Sen said on Saturday. "There is an effort to divide Indians…create a rift in the co-existence of Hindus and Muslims on account of political opportunism," Sen added. His statement came during a virtual address at the centenary celebration of ‘Anandabazar Patrika’.

302.title: Japan makes online insults punishable by one year in prison or fine
302.article_body: Japan's parliament has passed legislation making online insults punishable by imprisonment amid rising concerns regarding social media abuse. Offenders convicted of online insults can now be jailed for up to one year or fined 300,000 yen. The law came after reality TV celebrity Hana Kimura died after receiving online abuse from people on social media.

303.title: Don't want Alia to sacrifice her dreams after having a child: Ranbir
303.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said he does not want his wife and actress Alia Bhatt to sacrifice her dreams because she going to have a child. "Alia and I have been talking about it for some time now, how we're going to share our responsibilities...how we're going to share our time," he added. Alia announced her pregnancy on Instagram in June.

304.title: Uma Bharti writes to BJP chief Nadda against MP's new liquor policy
304.article_body: BJP leader and ex-CM of Madhya Pradesh Uma Bharti wrote to party President JP Nadda urging him to ensure that action is taken against Madhya Pradesh government's new liquor policy. "I do not go against party's set of rules, but I do not compromise with subjects that are related with my faith," Bharti said in her letter.

305.title: List of state-wise active COVID-19 cases released
305.article_body: The Union Health Ministry on Sunday informed that at present there are 1,28,690 active COVID-19 cases in India, with Kerala accounting for the maximum number of active cases at 28,571. This is followed by West Bengal (21,159), Tamil Nadu (18,842), Maharashtra (18,672), Karnataka (6,693), Telangana (5,189), Gujarat (4,046), Odisha (2,504), Uttar Pradesh (2,265), and Delhi (2,264).

306.title: Govt undertaking 'huge expense': Meenakashi Lekhi on Agnipath scheme
306.article_body: Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi said Indian government has chosen to undertake a "huge expense" by bringing in Agnipath scheme, while several countries make military service compulsory. "Here, the government is taking (recruiting) you officially and also paying you ₹22 lakh in four years…Where else does one get ₹22 lakh...This is a huge expense that the government is undertaking," she added.

307.title: India to double steel production in 8 years to 240 MT: Scindia
307.article_body: Newly-appointed Union Steel Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has said that India's steel production will double from the current 120 MT to 240 MT in the next eight years. "I will ensure that the production of steel in the country will enhance by taking medium and small industries along with the large units," he added.

308.title: Assam man burnt alive during public hearing for alleged murder, body buried
308.article_body: A man was allegedly burnt alive during a public hearing in Assam. He was burnt alive after he was allegedly found guilty of murdering a woman. The man's burnt body was buried. Police said that the man's body was excavated from the ground and that 90 per cent of it was recovered in burnt condition.

309.title: Fingers crossed, we're moving in the right direction: Rohit on T20 WC
309.article_body: After taking an unassailable 2-0 lead in the ongoing three-match T20I series against England, India captain Rohit Sharma said they're "moving in the right direction" ahead of the T20 World Cup in Australia later this year. "The only red flag I see is we shouldn't get carried away by these performances. We need to keep performing this way," he added.

310.title: Derbyshire's McKiernan creates world record for giving away most runs in a T20 match
310.article_body: Derbyshire leg-spinner Mattie McKiernan has created the world record for conceding most runs in a T20 match. The 28-year-old bowler conceded 82 runs in his four overs against Somerset in T20 Blast on Saturday. He was hit for eight sixes and five fours, and he finished with figures of 4-0-82-0. The previous record was held by Sarmad Anwar (4-0-81-0).

311.title: Inflation may ease gradually in 2nd half of 2022-23: RBI Governor
311.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has said that inflation may ease gradually in the second half of 2022-23. He added, "The supply outlook is appearing favourable and several high-frequency indicators point to the resilience of the recovery in the first quarter (April-June) of 2022-23...inflation may ease gradually in the second half of 2022-23, precluding...chances of a hard landing in India."

312.title: Dharam ji to Alia, range of talent in 'Rocky...' is phenomenal: Karan
312.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, speaking about his upcoming directorial 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', said he is excited to be working with veteran actors Dharmendra, Shabana Azmi, and Jaya Bachchan. "From Dharam ji to Alia Bhatt, the range of talent in the film is phenomenal," Karan added. The filmmaker added that the film also features "exciting actors" from Bengali cinema.

313.title: I don't regret or feel ashamed of films that I have done: Ranbir
313.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor has said he doesn't regret or feel ashamed of any film that he has done. He added he has always made a conscious decision about the roles he chooses and isn't ashamed to show his future children any of his films. "I'd like to hear from them 'papa, that was...a bad film' or 'papa that was...fun'," said Ranbir.

314.title: Had so much fun: Jamie Dornan on working with Alia in 'Heart of Stone'
314.article_body: After Alia Bhatt shared a post on Instagram announcing the wrap up of her Hollywood debut 'Heart of Stone', her co-star Jamie Dornan wrote in the comments section, "Had sooo much fun working with you!" "Good luck with (baby emoji)! And see you for promotion," he added. Alia is expecting her first child with Ranbir Kapoor.

315.title: Female-led film never gets same amount of screens as male-led film: Taapsee
315.article_body: Taapsee Pannu, speaking about the OTT platforms, said women artists are being celebrated on the platform due to the absence of risk factors. Comparing it with films with theatrical releases, she said, "A female-led film never gets the same amount of screen count as a male-led film, if released on the same day." "We've often gotten lesser screens," she added.

316.title: India reports 18,257 new COVID-19 cases, 42 deaths in last 24 hours
316.article_body: India has reported 18,257 COVID-19 cases, 14,553 recoveries and 42 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 18,840 cases and 43 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,28,690, while the death toll reached 5,25,428.

317.title: When ball swings, it motivates you to do well: Bhuvneshwar on 3/15 vs England
317.article_body: India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar, who was named 'Player of the Match' in the second T20I against England, has said he's enjoying his bowling and feeling confident in matches. "If the ball swings it motivates you to do well and I am confident right now," he stated. Bhuvneshwar dismissed Jason Roy, Jos Buttler and Richard Gleeson to register figures of 3/15.

318.title: Mumbai Police use victim's Instagram friends' list to track murder accused
318.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested murder accused of 21-year-old Vishal within eight hours of the incident with help of Instagram. As per police, there were no CCTV cameras in the vicinity and only information they had was the attackers' description. The police tracked Vishal's close friend using his Instagram friends' list who told them about the victim's dispute with two brothers.

319.title: Pothole campaign launched in Mumbai, 'Get Well Soon' cards sent to BMC chief
319.article_body: The Watchdog Foundation has started a 'Get Well Soon' citizen campaign against potholes in Mumbai. The campaign has been started by sending 'Get Well Soon' cards to BMC chief Iqbal Chahal to make civic officials wake up to the problems caused by potholes. The foundation has asked the public to come forward and send cards to civic authorities.

320.title: MS Dhoni visits Team India dressing room after T20I series win vs England, pics go viral
320.article_body: Former Team India captain MS Dhoni attended the second T20I between India and England at the Edgbaston on Saturday. He visited the team's dressing room following India's victory. The BCCI shared pictures from his visit on social media and wrote, "Always all ears when the great @mahi7781 talks!" Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant also shared a picture with Dhoni.

321.title: Pics of protesters sleeping on sofa, taking shower at SL President's house go viral
321.article_body: Pictures of protesters sleeping on sofa, taking shower, storming the kitchen and using gym equipment at Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's official residence have gone viral. Rajapaksa ran away after the protesters overran his palace in the country's capital, Colombo. This comes amid the worsening economic crisis in the country.

322.title: Even parents don't ask me so much about marriage than public: Sonakshi
322.article_body: Actress Sonakshi Sinha, speaking about the questions about her marriage, said, "Even my parents don't ask me so much about my marriage than the media and the public." She added her parents aren't bothered about her marriage as much as the public is. "Until I'm not ready to share my life with the world, I won't do it," she stated.

323.title: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja gets bail hours after arrest over stampede-like situation in Noida
323.article_body: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja, known as the 'Flying Beast', has been granted bail. He was arrested on Saturday under Section 188 after thousands of people gathered at a metro station in Noida to celebrate his birthday on his request. According to reports, there was a stampede-like situation at the station due to the rush, however, no casualties were reported.

324.title: Patently untrue: Amnesty India on money laundering allegations by ED
324.article_body: Amnesty International India has tweeted that the allegations levelled by Enforcement Directorate against them for money laundering are "patently untrue". It added, "Putting a squeeze on critics through trumped-up charges...has become routine for...government." The ED fined Amnesty India and former CEO Aakar Patel over ₹61 crore citing violations of the Foreign Exchange Management Act.

325.title: Witnessed people, bags being swept: Amarnath Yatra pilgrim recalls experience
325.article_body: Speaking about the Amarnath cloudburst incident which killed several people, one of the survivors Sumit, recalled how the gushing water washed away the tents. "We only saw water everywhere. We all had a harrowing experience as we witnessed people and bags being swept away by strong waves," Sumit said. "Within 10 minutes, eight casualties were reported," he said.

326.title: If elected, would urge govt to resolve Kashmir issue permanently: Sinha
326.article_body: Opposition’s Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha on Saturday said that if elected, he would urge the government to resolve the Kashmir issue permanently and restore peace in the region. "If elected...one of my priorities would be to urge the government to…restore peace, justice, democracy, normalcy and end the hostile development towards Jammu and Kashmir," Sinha added.

327.title: We deserved to lose: Buttler on 49-run defeat in 2nd T20I vs India
327.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler said they deserved to lose the second T20I against India as they didn't play anywhere close to what they wanted in the game. "Any time you lose three wickets in the powerplay it is hard to catch up," he added. Chasing India's 171-run target, England were reduced to 27/3 before getting bundled out for 121 runs.

328.title: People say 'Enough of women empowerment': Taapsee on her female-centric films
328.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, while speaking about her production house backing female-centric movies, said that people tell her, "Enough of women empowerment now". "The subject apparently feels jaded to the world...[The subject of] heroes taking revenge or men saving women doesn't feel exploited, but women standing up for their rights feels overexposed," she added.

329.title: We're moving towards gaining 100% results on issues of national consensus: Shah
329.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that we are moving towards achieving 100% results on issues that require building a national consensus. "He said although the role of the (zonal) council is advisory, he is happy that in his three years of experience, over 75% of issues in the (zonal) council have been resolved by consensus," an official statement said.

330.title: Man arrested by Delhi Police for cheating woman via matrimonial site
330.article_body: Delhi Police has arrested a man for allegedly posing as an ITBP officer on a matrimonial site and borrowing ₹12 lakh from a woman on the pretext of paying his family's medical bills. It was revealed during a police investigation that the 29-year-old man had several online matrimonial profiles with different names and duped several women of lakhs of rupees.

331.title: Video shows suitcases being loaded on Lanka Navy ship amid reports of President escaping
331.article_body: A video is going viral on social media which shows suitcases being loaded onto the Sri Lanka Navy Ship Gajabahu anchored at the Colombo port. Local media claimed that the suitcases were of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. Rajapaksa reportedly escaped from his residence on Saturday afternoon after a mob, raising slogans of 'Gota, go home', overran the building's compound.

332.title: Abe was linked to religious group that caused mother's bankruptcy: Shooter to police
332.article_body: The man who shot Japan's former PM Shinzo Abe believed that the latter was linked to a religious group he blamed for his mother's bankruptcy, police told the local media. "My mother got wrapped up in a religious group and I resented it," reported local media quoting Tetsuya Yamagami. He reportedly spent months planning the attack with a homemade gun.

333.title: Congress can even join hands with terrorists to be in power: BJP's Patra
333.article_body: Reacting to the Congress party's statement that it will hold nationwide press conferences to counter BJP’s "fake nationalism", BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said that Congress can even join hands with terrorists to be in power. Patra further said that the 10 years of UPA rule were "marked by frequent terror attacks" across India while PM Narendra Modi-led government controlled terrorism.

334.title: Rain expected in B'luru till July 13, city to remain chilly for 4 days: IMD
334.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that Bengaluru will continue receiving rainfall till July 13. "Bengaluru will continue to have chilly weather for next [four] days due to monsoon. July is the peak monsoon month. Since the Western Ghats are receiving heavy rain, the westerly winds are cold and Bengaluru is also facing its impact," an IMD scientist said.

335.title: Rishabh Pant's chat with Rohit Sharma after bowler comes in front of him goes viral
335.article_body: A video of Rishabh Pant's conversation with Rohit Sharma after England fast bowler David Willey came in front of him while they were running a single has gone viral. "Saamne aa gaya tha...Takkar maar du kya? (He came in front of him. Should I hit him?)" Pant said. Rohit responded, "Maar de. aur kya? (Hit him. What else?)"

336.title: Who will construct demolished wall: Banners on Hyd wall after BJP meet
336.article_body: The Parade Ground Walkers' Association has put up banners on the ground wall that was reportedly demolished for the public assembly for the Bharatiya Janata Party meeting on July 3. "Who will construct this demolished wall? Cantonment Board or BJP leaders?" the banners read. Pictures of the banners were shared on Twitter.

337.title: Actress Payal Rohatgi marries wrestler Sangram Singh in Agra, shares pics
337.article_body: Actress Payal Rohatgi tied the knot with wrestler Sangram Singh on Saturday in Agra. Payal and Sangram had first met in 2011 and the duo got engaged in 2014. The couple tied the knot in a traditional Hindu wedding ceremony attended by their friends and family. Payal completed her bridal look with heavy jewellery and minimal make-up.

338.title: Haryana govt to audit all 24 private universities
338.article_body: The Haryana government is set to order an audit of 24 private universities in the state, amid complaints that many institutions are flouting rules. The move comes after a show-cause notice was sent to Ashoka University, accusing it of "financial embezzlement" and violating the Haryana Private Universities Act. Erring universities could be fined up to ₹1 crore, an official said.

339.title: 2 teachers on panchayat poll duty killed in road mishap in MP
339.article_body: Two teachers on panchayat poll duty died on the spot after their car hit a tree in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district on Saturday. Shrikant Bahroliya, 42, and Laxmikant Patel, 40, were returning from poll duty when the mishap occurred, an official said. Two other occupants of the car were injured in the incident.

340.title: SC verdict on gangster Abu Salem's plea to come on July 11
340.article_body: The Supreme Court will deliver its verdict on July 11 on a petition by jailed gangster Abu Salem who has contended that his prison term cannot exceed 25 years under the extradition treaty between India and Portugal. Salem's counsel has further argued that his period of detention in Portugal should be set off against his sentence of imprisonment in India.

341.title: Macau to shut down casinos for a week to curb COVID-19 cases
341.article_body: Authorities on Saturday ordered the closure of casinos and other businesses for one week from Monday in view of the surge in COVID-19 cases in Macau. However, essential businesses like supermarkets, pharmacies and hotels will remain open, officials said. As per authorities, Macau recorded 71 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday, which takes the total cases reported since mid-June to 1,374.

342.title: Biden praises CIA for warning on Russian invasion of Ukraine
342.article_body: US President Joe Biden has officially thanked the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) staff for cautioning the world ahead of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, describing it as the "quiet bravery" of American spies. Marking the CIA's 75th anniversary on Friday, Biden said he had been involved with the agency for 52 years, starting as junior senator in 1975.

343.title: UN blames Ukraine and Russia for attack on nursing home
343.article_body: A recent United Nations report has blamed Russian and Ukrainian forces for the infamous assault on a nursing home in Luhansk in March during the early stages of the war between the countries. The report said Ukrainian forces took positions inside the building, making it a target. Of the 71 persons in the building, 22 have been accounted as survivors.

344.title: Very unfortunate for Deepak to miss out: Irfan on India-England 2nd T20I
344.article_body: Following batter Deepak Hooda's omission from India's playing XI for second T20I against England in Birmingham, Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Very unfortunate for Deepak to miss out in this red hot form." In the first T20I in Southampton, Deepak batted at number three and scored 33 runs off 17 balls. He scored 47*, 104 in the recent India-Ireland two-match T20I series.

345.title: 6 Indian students participating in 63rd International Maths Olympiad
345.article_body: Six Indian students, Pranjal, Atul, Arjun, Adhitya, Vedant, Kaustav, are participating in the 63rd International Mathematical Olympiad, which is being held in Norway's capital Oslo. The Olympiad will run for two days on July 11 and 12, where contestants in teams of six must solve mathematical problems. Reportedly, about 600 students from around the world are participating in the Olympiad.

346.title: 32-year-old man arrested after Indian fans allege racism during Edgbaston Test
346.article_body: Birmingham Police have arrested a 32-year-old man for "racially aggravated public order offence", following allegations of racist abuse aimed at Indian fans during the rescheduled fifth Test between India and England at Edgbaston. Several Indian fans had taken to Twitter to report the racist behaviour they endured during the fourth day's play on Monday.

347.title: Sri Lankan President has agreed to resign on July 13, says Parliament Speaker
347.article_body: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has agreed to step down on July 13, according to the Speaker of the Parliament Mahinda Yapa Abeywardana. Rajapaksa has faced a wave of anti-government protests amid a worsening economic crisis. Earlier on Saturday, reports had said that Rajapaksa ran away after protestors surrounded his residence.
