348.title: Ukraine President sacks envoy to India, 4 other nations
348.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy dismissed Kyiv's ambassador to India on Saturday as well as several other foreign envoys, the presidential website said. In a decree that gave no reason for the move, he announced the sacking of Ukraine's ambassadors to India, Germany, Czech Republic, Norway and Hungary. It was not immediately clear if the envoys would be handed new jobs.

349.title: I didn't expect to be in the 2nd week: Rybakina on winning Wimbledon
349.article_body: After winning Wimbledon, Kazakhstan's Elena Rybakina said she didn't expect to be in the second week and to be a winner is amazing. "I wouldn't be here without my team of course, so I want to say a big thanks to them. And most importantly my parents." Notably, Rybakina was contesting a Wimbledon main draw for only the second time.

350.title: 9 killed as flood currents drag car into river in Uttarakhand
350.article_body: Nine people were killed and one sustained injuries after strong flood currents dragged their car into the Dhela river in Uttarakhand's Nainital district. Officials said the water levels in the river had increased due to heavy rains on Friday morning and that it was dark at the time of the accident. Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami condoled the deaths.

351.title: 'Shabaash Mithu' is balanced, shows success and failures: Director
351.article_body: 'Shabaash Mithu' director Srijit Mukherji has said that the upcoming film has a balanced approach, adding that it doesn't show only success but also failures. "When you have such achievements, you can't glorify or not glorify them. You show them the way they happened," the director added. The film is based on former Indian women's cricket team captain Mithali Raj.

352.title: Unacademy expands ESOP pool to $393 million: Report
352.article_body: Edtech unicorn Unacademy has expanded its employee stock ownership plan (ESOP) pool to $393 million, Inc42 reported citing sources. The Bengaluru-based startup increased its ESOP pool size to 286 million options from 238.7 million options, as per the company's regulatory filings with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs. Notably, the company sacked 150 employees last month.

353.title: Need to develop forward-looking higher education institutions: Pradhan
353.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Saturday said we need to develop forward-looking, responsive and world-class higher education institutions in order to prepare 21st century-ready students. "National Education Policy 2020 gives us the direction and path for decolonizing our education and achieving aspirations, creating pride in our languages, culture and knowledge," Pradhan said.

354.title: Chinese man with 'urinary issues' told he has ovaries, uterus & has been menstruating
354.article_body: A 33-year-old Chinese man, who believed he had urinary problems after years of finding blood in his urine, was told by doctors he had ovaries and uterus. He also discovered recently that he had been menstruating for 20 years and had both male and female genitalia. He then underwent surgery to have his female reproductive organs removed.

355.title: US places visa restrictions on top Cuban officials
355.article_body: The US State Department on Saturday announced visa restrictions against 28 high-ranking Cuban officials for allegedly cracking down on peaceful protesters in Cuba last year. The restrictions will be applicable on members of the Cuban Communist Party, and authorities in the country's communications and media sectors. The US accused these officials of violent detention of protesters and sham trials.

356.title: Several injured as bus carrying 50 falls into gorge after tyre burst in Guj
356.article_body: A bus carrying over 50 passengers fell into a gorge in Gujarat's Dang district on Saturday. According to Minister of State for Home Harsh Sanghavi, several passengers have sustained injuries in the accident, which took place due to a tyre burst. Police reached the spot after getting information. A rescue operation is underway, Sanghavi added.

357.title: Refrain from commenting: Twitter tells staff after Musk ends deal
357.article_body: Twitter has instructed its employees not to comment about Elon Musk pulling out of an agreement to buy the platform. "You should refrain from Tweeting, Slacking, or sharing any commentary about the merger agreement," the company's General Counsel Sean Edgett said in a memo. Twitter plans to pursue legal action against Musk to enforce the deal.

358.title: Pope Francis prays for Japan after Shinzo Abe's assassination
358.article_body: Pope Francis prays that Japan will stay strong in its commitment to non-violence and heal from the “senseless” killing of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, the Vatican said on Saturday. In a social media message, Francis said he was “deeply saddened” by Abe's assassination. He expressed condolences to Abe's family and the people of Japan.

359.title: Undeniable that Shinzo Abe's security cover had flaws: Police
359.article_body: Tomoaki Onizuka, police chief of the Nara Prefecture, where former Japanese PM Shinzo Abe was shot dead, said on Saturday that it was "undeniable" that there were flaws in Abe's security cover. However, he did not list any specific shortcomings in the security measures undertaken for Abe. Onizuka said that a thorough investigation will be conducted to ascertain what happened.

360.title: I was super nervous: Rybakina after her 1st Grand Slam win at Wimbledon
360.article_body: World number 23 Elena Rybakina said her maiden Grand Slam win at Wimbledon is special because she was "super nervous" before and during the match. "I'm honestly happy that it's over. I've never felt something like this," she added. The 23-year-old defeated Ons Jabeur to become the first player from Kazakhstan to win a Grand Slam singles title on Saturday.

361.title: Russia assembling reserve forces near Ukraine: UK intelligence
361.article_body: Russia is moving reserve forces from across the country and assembling them near Ukraine for future offensive operations, the UK Ministry of Defence said on Saturday. A large proportion of the new infantry units are probably MT-LB armoured vehicles taken from long-term storage as the primary transport, it said, adding MT-LBs have very limited armour protection.

362.title: Jaishankar meets Lavrov, Blinken on sidelines of G-20 meet in Bali
362.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met Russian counterpart Sergey Lavrov and US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on the sidelines of the G-20 Foreign Ministers' Conclave in Bali, Indonesia on Friday. Jaishankar discussed the Russia-Ukraine war and other regional issues with the leaders. India has called for diplomacy to end the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

363.title: Man arrested for alleged rape of his minor daughter in Rajasthan
363.article_body: A man was sent to judicial custody on Friday after being arrested for allegedly raping his minor daughter in Rajasthan's Hanumangarh district, police said. The girl has claimed in her FIR that her father had been raping her for one-and-a-half years years, police added. Police further said that the girl narrated her ordeal to her uncle.

364.title: It's a personal call by him: CSK official on Jadeja deleting CSK-related Instagram posts
364.article_body: Reacting to Ravindra Jadeja deleting some posts related to Chennai Super Kings (CSK) on his Instagram account, a CSK official told ANI, "This is a personal call by him." Further, refuting reports of any rift, the official added, "We are not aware of such kinds of incidents from our side. All OK. Nothing is wrong."

365.title: Tribal woman, set ablaze in MP last week, cremated in her village
365.article_body: Rampyari Bai, the tribal woman who died after being allegedly set ablaze by a group of men in MP's Guna district was cremated in her native village on Saturday. She was set on fire on July 2 over a land dispute. District Collector Frank Noble said the victim's family will get ₹8.25 lakh aid. Five persons have been arrested.

366.title: India defeat England in 2nd T20I, win 7th int'l series in a row under Rohit's captaincy
366.article_body: India defeated England by 49 runs in the second T20I at Edgbaston in Birmingham to take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series. With this, India recorded their 19th consecutive match win and seventh consecutive series win in international cricket under Rohit Sharma's captaincy. The third T20I will take place at Trent Bridge in Nottingham tomorrow.

367.title: 23-year-old Rybakina becomes youngest women's Wimbledon champion since 2011
367.article_body: Kazakhstan's Elena Rybakina, who turned 23 last month, has become the youngest player to win women's singles title at Wimbledon since a 21-year-old Petra Kvitova in 2011. The world number 23  beat world number two Ons Jabeur 3-6, 6-2, 6-2 in the final on Saturday. Rybakina ended the Tunisian's 11-match winning streak. Notably, it is Rybakina's first Grand Slam title.

368.title: LeT terrorist arrested in J&K, arms and ammunition recovered
368.article_body: The security forces on Saturday arrested a hybrid terrorist of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) in the Kreeri area of Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla district, police said on Saturday. According to police, the terrorist, who has been identified as Mohammad Iqbal Bhat, was actively involved in providing logistics support for terror activities. Arms and ammunition have also been recovered from his possession.

369.title: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja arrested after fans gather at Noida metro station for his b'day
369.article_body: Police arrested YouTuber Gaurav Taneja after his followers gathered at Sector 51 metro station in UP's Noida to celebrate his birthday. Taneja, through Instagram, told his followers he'd celebrate his birthday at the metro station among fans, following which thousands of people reached the metro station. There was a stampede-like situation due to the rush, but no casualties were reported.

370.title: Protesters set Sri Lankan PM's residence on fire after he agrees to quit, video surfaces
370.article_body: Protesters broke into the private residence of Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe and set it on fire, said his office. The protesters were seen damaging vehicles belonging to him. Wickremesinghe, who was appointed as Prime Minister in May, has announced that he will resign from his post to make way for an all-party government.

371.title: Missing T20 WC 2021 was one of the low points in my career: Ferguson
371.article_body: New Zealand pacer Lockie Ferguson has said missing 2021 T20 World Cup was probably one of the low points in his career. Ferguson was ruled out of World Cup squad due to a calf injury. Ferguson added that with a lot of cricket coming up he has the opportunity to work on his game leading into 2022 T20 World Cup.

372.title: Those using religion to divide people can't be true spiritualists: TN CM
372.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Saturday said that religion cannot be a tool to divide people and those who cause such a division cannot be true spiritualists. Addressing a gathering in Tiruvannamalai, Stalin said, "I don't care about those who utter lies and seek cheap publicity. Even you should not care but move on to embrace development."

373.title: Maoist hideout busted at Odisha-Chhattisgarh border, 60 Maoists escape
373.article_body: Police said a Maoist hideout was busted at the Odisha-Chhattisgarh border after a gunfight with the security forces. However, over 60 Maoists, including some female cadres, managed to escape the camp in Nuapada, police added. "Around 10 am on Friday, 60-80 Maoists opened fire, targeting the forces," police said, adding the forces retaliated and the gunfight lasted for an hour.

374.title: Crypto firm Blockchain.com loses $270 mn on loans to bankrupt firm 3AC
374.article_body: Cryptocurrency firm Blockchain.com has lost $270 million on its loans to crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital (3AC), according to Blockchain.com CEO Peter Smith's letter to the shareholders. This comes days after 3AC filed for bankruptcy, seeking protection from creditors in the US. Smith said that Blockchain.com remains liquid and solvent and its customers will not be impacted.

375.title: 'We don't get dirt in our eyes as they're small', jokes Naga minister; video viral
375.article_body: A video of Nagaland Higher Education and Tribal Affairs Minister Temjen Imna Along's speech on 'advantages of having small eyes' has gone viral online. "People say northeast Indians have small eyes...but I can see very well," joked Along. He added, "There are advantages to small eyes. We don't get dirt in our eyes. We can easily sleep during long programmes."

376.title: Learnt horse-riding for 'Shamshera', they need emotional connect: Vaani
376.article_body: Actress Vaani Kapoor has revealed that she had to take horse-riding lessons for her upcoming film 'Shamshera' which features Ranbir Kapoor and Sanjay Dutt. "You need that emotional connect with the animal. They will throw you off otherwise," she said. The actress added that she used to get a whole packet of biscuits to feed and befriend her horse.

377.title: J&K LG chairs high-level meet to review rescue op at Amarnath cave
377.article_body:
Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Saturday held a high-level meeting to review the ongoing rescue and relief operation at Amarnath cave. Two-minute silence was also observed during the meeting to pay tribute to devotees who lost their lives after the cloudburst happened in the lower reaches of the Amarnath cave on Friday, 
Office of J&K LG tweeted.

378.title: I had a DIY wedding & forgot to click pictures: Radhika Apte
378.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte has revealed that she has no pictures of her wedding with British violinist-composer Benedict Taylor because they forgot to click them. "We had a DIY marriage. We called our friends, made food ourselves...and partied. But no pictures," the actress said. The couple had a small wedding in 2012 before an official ceremony in 2013.

379.title: Tribals clash with forest officials in Telangana, 5 detained
379.article_body: Five tribal women were detained after a clash broke out between tribal members and forest authorities in Telangana's Mancherial. The clash broke out when the tribal members fought against the demolition of their huts on forest territory and three officials were injured. "But now they're telling us we can't even cultivate here. They're demolishing our huts," a protester said.

380.title: Can we change our self talk: Raqesh on rumours of breakup with Shamita
380.article_body: Addressing rumours of his breakup with Shamita Shetty, actor Raqesh Bapat recently shared a monochrome picture of himself on social media. He wrote in the caption, "Who is dating whom? Who is cheating whom?...vs...How can I be a better version of myself? Can we change our self talk? Is it that difficult?" The couple began dating during 'Bigg Boss OTT'.

381.title: Hundreds of users order food, alcohol for free as DoorDash app faces glitch in US
381.article_body: Hundreds of people were able to place free orders for food and alcohol after the American food delivery app DoorDash faced a glitch in its systems. Several users tweeted pictures of their orders, which ranged from expensive tequila to emergency contraceptives, and were worth thousands of dollars. The company has, however, said that it is "actively cancelling fraudulent orders".

382.title: 5-yr-old boy falls asleep, gets locked in UP classroom; teacher suspended
382.article_body: Days after a five-year-old student of a government school in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia got locked in a classroom after falling asleep, the school's head teacher was suspended and action was initiated against five other faculty members, officials said. The boy was later rescued by his family members, who had to break down the classroom door, as per reports.

383.title: 3 die, 47 fall ill after drinking polluted water from open wells in Maha
383.article_body: Three persons died and 47 others fell ill after drinking polluted water from open wells in two villages of Maharashtra's Amravati district, an official said on Saturday. Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has announced an ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh each to the families of the deceased, as per a statement issued by the Chief Minister's Office (CMO).

384.title: Russia raising 'true hell' in eastern Ukraine: Luhansk Governor
384.article_body: Russian forces have managed to "raise true hell" in Ukraine's east, Luhansk Governor Serhiy Gaidai said on Saturday, after Moscow launched artillery, mortar and rocket strikes in an overnight attack on the province. Russian troops are now pressing towards neighbouring Donetsk, he said. The Kyiv government has asked citizens to evacuate Russian-occupied southern areas ahead of a military pushback.

385.title: Raids against Karti Chidambaram show CBI has no work to do: TN Cong
385.article_body: After the CBI conducted searches at Congress MP Karti Chidambaram's residence in Chennai on Saturday, Tamil Nadu Congress President KS Alagiri said that these raids show that the CBI has got no work to do. "How many times would they raid his house? They have not found anything," Alagiri said. "Congress strongly condemns this," he added.

386.title: Measures taken to rescue pilgrims from K’taka on Amarnath Yatra: CM
386.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said the government has taken all measures to rescue pilgrims from Karnataka who are on Amarnath Yatra after a cloudburst in Jammu and Kashmir. "Kannadigas from the state who are on Amarnath Yatra are safe," Bommai said. "Already about 15-20 Yatris have contacted us seeking help and providing information about their current location," he added.

387.title: Practice your religion but don't denigrate others' beliefs: Naidu
387.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Saturday said that religion is a personal matter, adding that while one can take pride and practice one's religion, no one has the right to denigrate others' religious beliefs. He added that sporadic incidents cannot undermine the country's commitment to the values of pluralism and inclusivity.

388.title: Don't step out unless an emergency: T'gana CM to citizens amid rains
388.article_body: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao on Saturday urged people not to venture out of their homes unless there is an emergency amid incessant rains in the state. He also instructed Chief Secretary Somesh Kumar to alert all the departments concerned and take safety measures amid heavy rainfall. The CM added that he was regularly reviewing the situation.

389.title: US concerned with China's 'alignment' with Russia: Blinken
389.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said that he raised Washington's concerns regarding China's "alignment" with Russia since the beginning of the war in Ukraine, during in-person talks with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Saturday. Blinken told reporters after the talks that he did not think China had acted neutrally, citing China's support to Russia in the United Nations.

390.title: How about India take 2007 T20 WC approach for 2022 T20 WC: Parthiv
390.article_body: Giving his opinion on Team India's preparations for T20 World Cup 2022, Parthiv Patel said, "How about India taking the 2007 T20 World Cup approach for this year's [T20] World Cup? More young faces and flamboyance." India won the inaugural T20 World Cup in 2007. Back then, Sachin Tendulkar, Sourav Ganguly and Rahul Dravid didn't play for the team.

391.title: Rybakina creates history, becomes 1st Kazakh player to win a Grand Slam singles title
391.article_body: World number 23 Elena Rybakina on Saturday created history by becoming the first-ever Kazakh player to win a Grand Slam singles title. The 23-year-old defeated world number two Ons Jabeur of Tunisia 3-6, 6-2, 6-2 to win the Wimbledon 2022 women's singles title. Both Rybakina and Jabeur were featuring in their first-ever Grand Slam final.

392.title: I don't support Kapil Dev's statements on Kohli: Rajkumar Sharma
392.article_body: Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said he doesn't support the statements made by Kapil Dev on the ex-India captain. Kapil said that if Ravichandran Ashwin can be dropped from Test side then Kohli can also be dropped from T20I side following the India batter's recent form. Kohli has been included in India's playing XI against England in second T20I.

393.title: 4 injured in Shanghai hospital knife attack, attacker shot by police
393.article_body: A knife-wielding attacker injured four people at Ruijin Hospital in China's Shanghai on Saturday, local police confirmed. Police added that they shot the assailant in order to subdue him. Videos of the chaos during the attack have surfaced on social media. This is purportedly the second stabbing incident in the city after the withdrawal of COVID-19 restrictions in early June.

394.title: Place facts about Amarnath tragedy before country: Sinha to govt
394.article_body: Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha on Saturday expressed deep anguish over the loss of life in the Amarnath cloudburst incident. He further said that the central government should place facts about the incident before the nation and not hide anything. Notably, the death toll due to the cloudburst near Amarnath cave in Jammu and Kashmir has risen to 16.

395.title: 2 men thrown from boat in 'Circle of Death' rescued from sea in US, video viral
395.article_body: Two men were rescued off the coast of Massachusetts earlier this week after their out-of-control motorboat came dangerously close to a tight circle pattern, known as a 'Circle of Death', authorities said. The two men were thrown from the vessel and were neither wearing lifejackets nor were tethered to the boat's kill switch. The men were not injured, said police.

396.title: 4 die, 24 fall ill after drinking contaminated water in Telangana
396.article_body: Four persons died and 24 others fell ill within one week in Telangana after allegedly drinking contaminated water from their residences in Gadwal. Police have, however, refuted the claims and said the deaths were caused due to issues of improper hygiene and seasonal complications. The patients have been admitted to a hospital and are said to be out of danger.

397.title: Adani Group confirms it will participate in India's first auction of 5G spectrum
397.article_body: Adani Group has confirmed that it will participate in India's first auction of 5G airwaves through the open bidding process to offer private network services. However, it said that it does not plan to enter the consumer mobility space. Other companies that have applied to acquire the telecom spectrum include Reliance Jio Infocomm, Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea.

398.title: Payal Rohatgi, Sangram Singh share pics from pre-wedding festivities
398.article_body: Actress Payal Rohatgi and wrestler Sangram Singh have shared pictures of their pre-wedding festivities on social media ahead of their wedding on Saturday in Agra. The pictures are from their sangeet, mehendi and haldi ceremonies. The couple will be hosting a reception in Delhi on July 14 and another reception in Mumbai at a later date.

399.title: Vivo India pauses all ads featuring Kohli amid money laundering probe: Report
399.article_body: Vivo India has temporarily put on hold advertisements featuring cricketer Virat Kohli amid the ED's ongoing investigation against the Chinese firm, The Economic Times reported. A Vivo executive said planned promotion activities involving Kohli were being put on hold until there's clarity on the money laundering probe. "This is also to protect Virat from criticism," another executive said.

400.title: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe resigns amid worsening crisis
400.article_body: Sri Lanka's Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe on Saturday announced his resignation. "To ensure the continuation of the government including the safety of all citizens I accept the best recommendation of the party leaders today, to make way for an all-party government. To facilitate this I will resign as Prime Minister," he tweeted. This comes amid worsening crisis in the country.
